This implies sacrifice as she gets up at 4 am every day to go to the market and buy what she needs for her sales.

The loan will be used to buy fruit and vegetables to sell as these are the products in most demand from her clients. In this way she will have more income and a better standard of living. Wendy's dream is to have a large stand in order to have everything the clients are looking for.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Martinha

texts.en:
Martinha, 35, opened her general store in 2000 with $100 she had saved. She works hard and so earns a good income from her business.

Martinha is now applying for a loan of $1,000 through Tuba Rai Metin. She will use her loan to buy a refrigerator and additional stock for her shop including water, Fanta, Sprite, Sagiko fruit juice, cigarettes, coffee, sugar, salt, milk, bread and slippers. She wants to make her business bigger and improve her living conditions in the process.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator and additional stock for her shop

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: He is 56 years old. In the last year, he participated in four automobile accidents. He presents cataracts in both eyes. This condition prevents him from performing his job as a taxi driver and he needs cataract surgery to continue working because he is part of the family support.

loans.use: to have eye surgery

loans.name: Leidy Yamileth

texts.es:
Leidy, de 29 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer año de bachillerato, está casada y su esposo trabaja de docente en una escuela cercana,viven en casa alquilada con sus dos hijos de 10 y 8 años de edad.

Leidy, trabaja en un hospital nacional, en el área de cocina desde hace diez años y su horario es de 7:00 a.m. a 
5:00 p.m. descansa un día a la semana.
 
El préstamo anterior lo utilizo para comprar útiles escolares como: papel, lapiceros, sacapuntas y lápices; ahora lo solicita para invertirlo en un comedor y comprar mesas, sillas y otras cosas que mas necesita, de esa forma lograra mejores ingresos y mejorara su calidad de vida.

El sueño de Leidy, es que sus hijos estudien y brindarles todo lo necesario, para mantener su negocio y su trabajo.
texts.en:
Leidy is 29 years old. She studied up to her third year of secondary school. She is married and her husband is a teacher in a nearby school. They live in a rented house with their two children, ages 10 and 8. 

Leidy has worked in the kitchen of a national hospital for the last ten years from 7:00 a.m. until 5:00 p.m., and she has one day off a week. 

She used her previous loan to buy school supplies such as paper, pens, pencil sharpeners and pencils. Now she is seeking a loan to invest in a café, to buy tables, chairs and other necessities. With this she will earn more income and improve her quality of life. 

Leidy’s dream is that her children have an education and all that they need, and to maintain her business and working life.

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs and other essentials to set up a café.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: He is a single man. He presents traumatic cataracts in both eyes and the cost of the surgery is out of his economic possibilities, having currently saved less than half of the cost of surgery. But the urgency to have the surgery motivated him to seek help to pay for it because each day it is impossible to do his work as a taxi driver.

loans.use: to have eye surgery

loans.name: Leydi Siomara

texts.es:
Leydi, de 29 años de edad, estudio hasta séptimo grado, está casada y su esposo se encuentra fuera del país desde hace tres años, tienen tres hijos.

Leydi, trabaja de vendedora en un comedor donde venden desayunos y almuerzos todos los días, ademas venden
lácteos como queso, crema y quesillo, el negocio es de un familiar y el horario de trabajo es de 8:00 a.m. a 2:00 p.m.

Leydi, necesita el préstamo para invertirlo en materiales para cocinar y comprar mesas y sillas, porque se asociará con una prima, de esa forma logrará tener un negocio propio.

El sueño de Leydi, es que sus hijos tengan lo necesario y que su negocio sea sostenible y rentable.
texts.en:
Leydi, 29, studied up to seventh grade.  She's married and her husband has been abroad for three years.  They have three children.

Leydi works as a vendor in a canteen where they sell breakfast and lunch every day.  They also sell dairy products such as cheese, cream, and curd cheese.  The business is owned by a relative.  She works from 8 a.m. until 2 p.m.

Leydi needs the loan to invest in cooking supplies and buy tables and chairs.  She's going to work with a cousin, so she'll be able to have her own business.

Leydi's dream is for her children to have what they need and her business to be sustainable and profitable.

loans.use: to buy cooking supplies and tables and chairs to set up a diner

loans.name: Flora Bernadette

texts.en:
Flora Bernadette is 34 years old and has an eagerness to improve her services in her salon. She is married and had two children. 

In her salon, she extends friendly services to all her customers. She wants to improve her profits; that is why she is asking for additional capital of 50,000 PHP to buy more cosmetics and medicines used in the salon, such as hair dyes, spa treatments and colors. This will help gain more customers through the friendly and good services she offers.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics and medicines to use in the salon, such as hair dyes, spa treatments and colors.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase a variety of goods

loans.name: Deolita

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Deolita works hard to support her family.

She has a buying and selling of seaweeds business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing and raising pigs.  Deolita is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy sacks of seaweeds to sell for her seaweeds business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Deolita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy sacks fo seaweeds to sell for her business

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
Merly is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Merly is 44 years old and both of her children are in school.

Merly has a dry goods business in the Philippines. Merly requested a PHP10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of goods like clothing, school supplies and groceries.

Merly has been in this business for twelve years. In the future, Merly would like to save enough money so she continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of goods like clothing, school supplies and groceries

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 50 years old and married with three children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Gloria has a business buying and selling lumber in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more stock of hardwood to sell.

Gloria has been in this business for ten years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of hardwood to sell.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
A $1,500 loan is offered to Paulina to improve her business. She opened her kiosk in 2009 with her own working capital. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store like fruits and vegetables. She is generating a good income from selling.

She has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in doing business. She is living in a town with her family.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Julie Fe

texts.en:
Julie Fe is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a rice mill operator business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 27000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her rice mill for her rice mill operator business.

Julie Fe has been in this business for 4 years. Julie Fe earns additional income from a general store.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Julie Fe has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her rice mill

loans.name: Chanphiseth

texts.en:
Chanphiseth is a 35-year-old married worker of two children who lives in the Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. He has worked as a worker in a paper factory since 2012, earning around $10 each day. His two children attend school. His wife is 33 years old, and she works as a unit manager in a garment factory, earning approximately $8.33 each day. 

Chanphiseth would like to buy lumber and zinc sheets to renovate his house, but he is short of the money, so he needs a loan. This loan will help him have enough money to renovate his house and have a proper house to live in. For his future, Chanphiseth hopes that he will be able to help his two children in earning bachelor's degrees.

loans.use: to buy lumber and zinc sheets to renovate his house

loans.name: Vanna

texts.en:
Vanna is a 20-year-old single son of a family who is from the Tbong Khmum province in Cambodia. He is pursuing a bachelor’s degree, majoring in economics in his first year at university in the city. His parents are farmers, and his father is also a retired civil servant. 

Vanna lacks the finances to pay his university fees from the first to the fourth year, so he has decided to take out a loan. He will be able to graduate and earn skills for his future job with this loan. In the future, he dreams of having a good job with a decent salary; therefore, he will be able to help his parents to improve the family’s living standards.

loans.use: to pay his university fees

loans.name: Santa

texts.es:
Santa es una mujer de 60 años de edad, viuda, tiene 4 hijos independientes, y su negocio es la venta de helados tipo bolo.
Ella es emprendedora, decidida, paciente, amable, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla de forma ambulante en la zona ‘mutualista’ un área céntrica donde se construyeron edificios de comercios, públicos, universidades, escuelas y todo tipo de empresas comerciales, de clima cálido tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 18-35 grados centígrados.
Santa es de tez morena, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado estilo cola de caballo, ojos obscuros, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el Guaraní y habla español por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la realiza de forma independiente, sus hijos son independientes y viven con sus familias, ella vive en un cuarto alquilado construido de ladrillo y cemento que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de helado tipo bolo; El intenso calor de la ciudad, hacen de su labor un próspero negocio, porque los helados son consumidos a toda hora. El helado bolo se caracteriza por estar hecho de agua y algunos son de fruta y otras veces se les agrega leche, los encontramos de muchos sabores como; de lúcuma, mango, fresa, coco, maracuyá, chocolate, etc. y también mesclados; lúcuma con leche, fresa con leche, coco con leche, etc., y vienen envasados en un largo y delgado empaque plástico, tiene un precio muy accesible para la mayoría. “inicie mi negocio por la necesidad de trabajar de forma independiente, tengo que caminar mucho pero de esa manera la venta se realiza…” comenta. Su sueño es abrir una heladería, ella desea realizar la compra de insumos para la elaboración de helados bolo como, frutas, azúcar, leche y otros. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que se dedica a esta actividad de forma independiente. 
Es por esos motivos que Santa solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos de cocina para la elaboración de helados y abrir una heladería.
texts.en: Santa is a 60 year old woman. She is a widow, with 4 children who are independent, and her business is to sell bolo ice cream (popsicle style.) She is entrepreneurial, decisive, patient, kind, responsible and hard working. Her business is done on the street in the "mutualista" zone, a downtown zone known for commercial buildings, public buildings, universities, schools and all types of commercial enterprises, with a warm tropical climate, and a temperature fluctuating between 18-35 degrees Celsius. Santa has a dark complexion, black long hair tied in a pony tail, dark eyes, short stature,  stocky built. Her native language is Guarani and she speaks Spanish for her business. She lives her life independently. Her children live separately with their families, she lives in a rented room built of cement and brick, which has running water, electricity and a sewage system. Her business is to sell bolo ice cream (popsicle style.) The intense heat of the city makes  her job a prosperous one, because ice cream is consumed at any time. Bolo Ice cream is typically made with water, some are made with fruit, sometimes with milk.  We find many flavors such as: lucuma, mango, strawberry, coconut, passion fruit, chocolate, etc. and also mixed: lucuma with milk, strawberry with milk, coconut with milk, etc. They are packaged in a long, thin, plastic package and they have a very affordable price for the majority of people. "I started my business because I needed to work independently. I have to walk a lot but that is how I get to sell..." she stated. Her dream is to open an ice cream shop. She wants to buy inputs to make ice cream,  such as fruits, sugar, milk and others. This is the first time for loans with the institution in 3 years of doing this business. This is why Santa is requesting a loan to buy cooking inputs to make ice cream and open an ice cream shop.

loans.use: To buy inputs for cooking to make ice cream and open an ice cream store.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly busies herself with selling health products and food supplements. She is able to support her family from the commisions she earns. Nelly is into the dealership of health products and food supplements and wants to expand her business to purchase more inventory to sell. 

She has reached out to Paglaum MPC for the funding needs and applied for a loan of 3,000 PHP to start. 

She is happy to earn additional income. She hopes to open a store outlet in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase stock to increase inventory to sell

loans.name: Charmilou

texts.en:
Charmilou is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buying and selling of vegetables business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 14,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more stock of fruits and vegetables to sell for her business.

Charmilou has been in this business for two years. Charmilou earns additional income from pig fattening.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 54 years old, married and has six children.

Nenita is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Nenita requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Nenita has been raising pigs for seven years now, and has borrowed 13 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Nenita would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 52 years old and married with five children, two of whom are in school.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Helen is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feed and materials for pigpens renovation.

Helen has been pig fattening for 9 years and also earns additional income from farming rice and selling fruits and vegetables.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college and save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feed and materials for pigpen renovation

loans.name: Hanna

texts.en:
Hanna is 38 years old and married with four children, three of whom in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell for her business.

Hanna has borrowed and paid 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy and sell charcoal for 3 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell for her business

loans.name: Nenette

texts.en:
Nenette is 36 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

Nenette has borrowed and paid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from coconut palm making.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Angeila

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Angeila works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Angeila is borrowing 29,500 PHP through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Angeila has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF, and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida works hard to support her family. Nida is married and has a buy and sell nipa roofing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of nipa roofing to sell.

Nida has been in this business for 15 years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of nipa roofing to sell

loans.name: Isabelita

texts.en:
Isabelita is a hardworking female entrepreneur with seven children.

She runs a buy and sell nipa roofing in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of nipa roofing to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like fishing.

Isabelita dreams that one day she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of nipa roofing to sell

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa is 39 years old and married with seven children, five of whom are in school. Theresa works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a buying and selling of nipa (palm) roofing in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional nipa to sell.

Theresa has been in this business for nine years.

In the future, Theresa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional nipa (palm) roofing to sell

loans.name: Bebiana

texts.en:
Bebiana is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Bebiaba successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is relisting Bebiana's business profile in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Iluminada

texts.en:
Iluminada works hard to support her family. Iluminada is married and has a basket-weaving business in the Philippines.

She requested an 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of bamboo.

Iluminada has been in this business for 27 years now.

In the future, Iluminada would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of bamboo

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Mariée et âgée de 36 ans, Afi est une femme mère de trois enfants. Afi habite à Tokoin et vend des produits d’alimentations générales dans une boutique afin de gagner sa rentabilité. Pour arriver à ses fins, Afi s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché local. Pour commander des bidons d’huile, des sacs de riz et des cartons de spaghetti, Afi demande ce prêt pour réaliser son achat et disposer d’un revenu afin d’aider son mari dans l’éducation de leurs enfants.
texts.en: A married woman, 36 years old, Afi is the mother of three. She lives in Tokoin and sells grocery items in a store to earn a profit. To this end, she gets her supplies once a month at the local market. To order containers of oil, sacks of rice, and boxes of spaghetti, Afi is asking for this loan to make her purchases and to have an income to help out her husband in covering their children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase 7 containers of oil, 7 sacks of rice, and 6 boxes of spaghetti

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.en:
A $1,500 loan is offered to Saturnina to improve her business. She has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day. She will buy such goods as fruits, vegetables, chilies, tomatoes and garlic. She has been involving herself in business activities since 2012. She feels so comfortable to run her business because she can earn money every day.

Running a business has made Saturnina independent because she can be responsible for herself and also helping her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables, chilies, tomatoes and garlic

loans.name: Ayélé

texts.fr: Agée de 36 ans,  Ayélé est une femme mariée et vit à Soviépé avec ses deux enfants. Pour contribuer aux besoins  quotidiens  de la famille, Ayélé vend des produits d’alimentations générales qu’elle expose dans son quartier. Ayélé s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché local. Ayélé demande ce crédit pour lancer une commande de sac de riz, de bidon d’huile et de sac de haricot afin de disposer d’un stock nécessaire pour satisfaire ses clients.
texts.en: 36 years old, Ayélé is a married woman living in Soviépé with her two children. To contribute to the daily needs of her family, Ayélé sells general food products, which she displays in her neighborhood. Ayélé stocks up twice a month in the local market. Ayélé is asking for this loan to put out an order for a bag of rice, a container of oil and a bag of beans, in order to have the stock available to satisfy her clients.

loans.use: to purchase one bag of rice, one container of oil, and one bag of beans.

loans.name: Alirio De Jesus

texts.es:
Alirio es un hombre muy cortes y trabajador, vive en un núcleo familiar muy amoroso constituido por su pareja y sus dos hijos adolescentes un hombre de 15 años y una mujer de 16 años, ellos están próximos a graduarse y es algo que tiene a Alirio muy motivado y feliz, ver cómo crecen y se educan para buscar un mejor Futuro.

Alirio trabaja diariamente en su carnicería, como tal vende carne de res, cerdo, y algo de pollo y pescado pero principalmente los dos primeros. En su negocio ofrece un empleo pero se proyecta para seguir pro una buena senda de ventas y pensar en un año montar una segunda sucursal.

El sueño de Alirio es mejorar su negocio, aumentar las ventas y prepararse principalmente para la siguiente etapa de sus hijos, que será la universidad, la cual para los padres representa un gran gasto y Alirio quiere gestar este sueño a sus dos pequeños.

Alirio en el momento se encuentra solicitando un préstamo para la compra de un congelador y surtido de carne de res y cerdo.
texts.en: Alirio is a very respectful and hard working man. He lives in a very loving home with his partner and their two teenage children, a 15 year old boy and a 16 year old girl. They are close to graduation,  and this is something that keeps Alirio very motivated and happy, to watch them grow and to educate them for a better future. Alirio works daily in his butcher shop. As such,  he sells beef and pork meats, some chicken and fish,  but primarily the first two items. In his business,  he makes a living but he is projecting himself to continue a good sales trend, and he thinks about starting a second location in a year. Alirio's dream is to improve his business, to increase sales, and to prepare mainly for the next stage in his children's lives which will be college. This represents a big expense for parents and Alirio wants to make this dream come true for his two children. Alirio is currently asking for a loan to buy a freezer and a variety of beef and pork meats.

loans.use: To buy a freezer and a variety of  beef and pork meats. This is the opportunity for growth.

loans.name: Les Jeunes Ferrailleurs 01 Group

texts.fr: Antoine, membre représentatif de groupe de 5 membres est marié, père de 5 enfants dont 3 majeurs qui travaillent et 2 continuent d'aller à l'école. Antoine est ferrailleur et cela fait 27 ans qu'il exerce ce métier. Il offre ses services à différent niveau mais surtout dans les constructions des maisons en s'occupant de tout ce qui est fer. Il a besoin de ce crédit pour s'équiper en matériel nécessaire pour son travail. A la fin du crédit, Antoine aura une épargne de 35 000 francs à ACFIME et aura un revenu aussi qui lui permettra de continuer son activité.
texts.en: Antoine, a representative member of a group of five, is a married father of five children (3 adults who are working and 2 still in school). Antoine works in hardware and has been in this trade for 27 years. He offers his services to different areas but especially to house builders by taking care of anything made of iron. He has need of this loan to equip himself with the supplies necessary for his work. At the end of the loan, Antoine will have savings of 35,000 francs at ACFIME and will also have an income enabling him to continue his work.

loans.use: to purchase iron and clamps or pliers for his work

loans.name: Claudina

texts.es:
Claudina es una mujer de 65 años de edad, viuda, tiene un hijo de 21 años, y su negocio es la elaboración y venta de mantas de alpaca y vicuña.
Ella es emprendedora, optimista, de buena actitud, paciente, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona ‘Villa dolores’ el área más antigua y populosa de la ciudad, donde los pobladores habitan no existe mucho comercio pero si manufactura para ser comerciado en otras ciudades, de clima frío y seco con una temperatura ambiente que varía durante el día entre 0-12 grados centígrados.
Claudina es de tez morena, cabello gris largo lo usa trenzado, ojos pardos, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su forma de vestir es tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), su lengua materna es el Aymará que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su hijo que estudia y trabaja, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y cuenta con agua potable, electricidad, gas domiciliario y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la confección de mantas de vicuña y alpaca. Las mantas son una prenda de vestir que lo usan las mujeres de vestir tradicional ‘las cholitas’ como abrigo sobre la espalda, son muy apreciadas y varían según los diseños y la moda. “inicié mi negocio hilando la lana de alpaca y la vendía a tejedoras poco a poco me fui introduciendo a la confección de tejidos que es mi nuevo emprendimiento…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que ella cuenta con una amplia experiencia en el mercado y tiene clientes constantes, la desventaja es que no cuenta con un puesto fijo de venta y vende ambulantemente. Su sueño es contar con una tienda de tejidos en alpaca, ella desea realizar la compra de lana de alpaca y vicuña para hilarla y confeccionar mantas de cholita. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 6 años que se dedica a esta actividad de forma independiente.
Es por esos motivos que Claudina solicita un préstamo para la compra de lana de vicuña y alpaca para hilarla y confeccionar mantas de cholita.
texts.en: Claudina is a 65 year old widow, mother of a 21 year old son. Her business is to make and sell alpaca and vicuna shawls. She is entrepreneurial, optimistic, with a good attitude, patient, responsible and hard working. She works in the "Villa Dolores" zone, the oldest and most populated area in the city. In the area where the people live there is not much commerce, but mainly manufacturing to be sold in other cities, with a cold and dry climate and an average temperature which fluctuates between 0-12 degrees Celsius. Claudina has a dark complexion, long, gray, braided hair, brown eyes, short stature, thin built. Her dress attire is traditional (hat, shawl, and big skirt,) her native language is Aymara which is spoken in the area. She speaks Spanish as general knowledge and to do business. She shares her life with her son who works and studies. They live in their own home built of brick and cement with a corrugated iron roof, running water, electricity, a sewage system and home delivered gas. Her business is to manufacture vicuna and alpaca shawls. These shawls are a clothing accesory used by traditional indigenous women (las cholitas) to warm their shoulders. They are well liked, and they vary based on designs and fashion. "I started my business weaving alpaca wool and I used to sell it to the weavers. Little by little, I started getting involved in manufacturing these knits which is my new enterprise..," she stated. Her advantage is that she has extensive experience in the market and she has consistent clients. Her disadvantage is that she doesn't have a steady point of sale and she sells on the street. Her dream is to have a store of alpaca knits. She wants to purchase the alpaca and vicuna wool to weave it and to make cholita shawls. This is the second time for a loan with the institution in the 6 years she has been involved in this activity independently. Thus, Claudina asks for a loan to buy vicuna and alpaca wool to weave it and to make cholita shawls.

loans.use: To buy vicuna and alpaca wool to weave and make traditional shawls.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Her name is Melanie, 32. She is a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Glen, a tricycle driver, and has four children who are elementary students. She and her husband work hard to meet their everyday needs and to support their children's schooling. 

Melanie operates a tricycle unit. Her  husband drives the tricycle that carries up to four passengers. In the Philippines, especially in the provinces like Cavite, the tricycle is a common means of transportation. Jeepneys and buses are limited. Very few people own a vehicle. The town people usually ride a tricycle from their homes to market, church, to their friend’s homes and to other destinations within their community. They even transport people from one town to the other. Aside from operating a tricycle, she also sells charcoal burners. She earns a minimum of 800 PHP a day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan which she will use to buy gas and pay for maintenance of her tricycle. She is positive that this will boost her income as the tricycle is really a necessity in their community. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help and a good return, for it will surely help cover their daily needs and fund her children's education.

Melanie dreams to be successful in her business so she can give her children the best education. She prays for the safety of her husband and their passengers. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and this is were she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the gas and maintenance of her tricycle unit.

loans.name: Rosela

texts.en:
Rosela is 59 years old and married.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy and sell nipa roofing in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional nipa roofing to sell.

Rosela has borrowed and paid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy and sell nipa roofing for 20 years and also earns an income from a general store.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional nipa roofing to sell

loans.name: Terry

texts.en:
Terry is 53 years old and married with seven children, three of whom are in school. Terry works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a nipa roofing making and selling in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase bamboo, plastic rope, etc.

Terry has been in this business for 10 years. 

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase bamboo, plastic rope, etc

loans.name: Mimi

texts.en:
Mimi is 52 years old and married. She works very hard to help her husband.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, candies, chips, soap, shampoo, etc.

Mimi has been in this business for two years.

In the future, Mimi would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, candies, chips, soap, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Kossiwavi

texts.fr: A 34 ans, Kossiwavi est une femme mariée et avec ses deux  enfants elle vit dans le quartier d’Agoè. Pour répondre aux besoins de la famille et soutenir son mari, Kossiwavi vend des produits d’alimentations générales dont des arachides et des biscuits en particulier. Kossiwavi s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois au marché. Kossiwavi nécessite ce crédit pour acheter des arachides et des biscuits afin de gagner plus de bénéfices et venir en aide à l’éducation scolaire de ses enfants.
texts.en: At 34 years old, Kossiwavi is a married mother who lives with her two children in the Agoè neighborhood. To meet the needs of her family and support her husband, Kossiwavi sells general food products, especially peanuts and cookies. Kossiwavi stocks up four times a month at the market. Kossiwavi needs this loan to buy peanuts and cookies in order to gain more profits and aid in the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy 21 bottles of peanuts and 22 boxes of cookies.

loans.name: Maria Estela

texts.es:
María, de 49 años de edad, estudió hasta sexto grado, es madre soltera de dos hijos, ya son mayores de edad, la mayor reside en estados unidos y el menor está estudiando bachillerato.

María, se dedica a comprar ganado para engordarlos y luego venderlos, decidió iniciar con este negocio debido a que
es madre soltera y solo ella ha tenido que crecer a sus hijos, su hijo menor le ayuda en comprar el ganado.
 
El préstamo lo solicita para comprar una vaca lechera, para ordeñarla y vender la leche para obtener ingresos extras.

El sueño de María es  tener siempre lo necesario para su hijo y volver a ver a su hija.
texts.en: María is 49 years old, she studied until 6th grade. She is a single mother with two adult children. The oldest girl lives in the USA,  and the youngest boy is in high school. Maria works buying livestock to fatten it and then sell it. She decided to start this business because she is a single mother and she is the only one raising her children. Her youngest son helps her buy the livestock. She is asking for a loan to buy a milk cow, to milk it and then sell the milk to obtain extra earnings. Maria's dream is to have enough to support her son and to see her daughter once again.

loans.use: To buy a milk cow.

loans.name: Hector De Jesus

texts.es:
Héctor es un hombre de 46 años de edad, separado de su esposo, atiende un negocio de miscelánea, el cual representa el 100% de sus ingresos parte de su dinero se lo envía a su exesposa para el sostenimiento de su hija adolescente y procura tener una estabilidad y buscar oportunidades para crecer.
El negocio de Héctor es compartido junto con una socia montaron el local, pero en el momento su mayor inconveniente es justamente su socia, que no se le ven ánimos de progresar de arriesgarse a impulsar y llevar su negocio a otro nivel.
Héctor siempre ha sido independiente y ahora se lo quiere demostrar a la socia por lo quiere pedir un préstamo, con dos finalidades, mejorar su negocio y su socia al no participar de este los ingresos serán netamente para él, lo pagara de su dinero y su intención final es generar recursos suficientes para comprarle su parte a ella.

Con el monto solicitado Héctor quiere comprar lo siguiente;
•	Impresora pos-térmica 
•	Impresora escáner
•	Fotocopiadora
•	Unidad de DVD
•	Accesorios para celular
•	Papelería
•	Estación de soldar
•	Ultrasonido
•	Aspiradora
texts.en:
Héctor is a man of 45 years of age. He is separated from his spouse. He looks after a variety store, which represents 100% of his income. Part of his money goes to his ex-wife, to support his teenage daughter. He tries to have stability, and seeks opportunities to grow.

Héctor's business is shared with his partner, who is set up on the premises. At the moment his biggest drawback is his partner. His partner does not see the courage of progressing with risk, to promote and move his business to another level. Héctor has always been independent, and now he wants to prove it to the partner. So he wants to ask for a loan, for two purposes. He will improve his business, and his partner will not participate, this income will be purely for Héctor. He will pay his money, and his ultimate intention is to generate enough resources to buy him out of it.

With the amount requested, Héctor wants to buy the following;
 •	Post-thermal printer
 •	Printer-Scanner
 •	Unit of DVD's
 •	Cell phone accessories
 •      Stationery
 •	Welding station
 •	Ultrasound
 •	Vacuum

loans.use: to buy a post-thermal printer, a printer-scanner, a photocopier, a unit of DVD's, cell phone accessories, among others described in the loan.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 54 years old and married with five children, one of whom is in school.

Lolita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Lolita has borrowed and repaid 9 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 25 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Lolita aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina, 30, is single and has three children. For almost 3 years she has sold bananas in their village with the use of her motorcycle. She earns a net income of PHP 350 daily. 

Her income is spent on their daily expenses. Due to the lack of capital for her business she would like to get a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase more bananas to sell. 

She is hoping that her business will continue to grow and become more productive.

loans.use: to purchase bananas to sell.

loans.name: Sadoqat

texts.en:
Sadoqat is a hardworking woman. She was born in 1972. She lives in remote district. She is from the northern part of a country. She is married. She has three children. She has twenty years experience in running a business. Sadoqat started a new business raising livestock. In addition, she plants agricultural products in her yard. She likes the agricultural business. She wants to develop her business to secure her future. 
She is planning to make a holiday–party for her son. She is asking financial support for the marriage of her son. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To organize a wedding party

loans.name: Mark Anthony

texts.en: Mark Anthony is 34 years old and has only one child . He is a farmer who lives in a rural community with his family. They earn their living through farming and hog-raising. Due to financial hardship, he aspires to further improve his hog-raising business in order to earn a higher income. Having inadequate capital, he would like to avail of a loan of PHP 10,000.00 to buy the feed, vitamins and vaccines for his hogs. He is hoping that this financial assistance will enable him to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy the feed, vitamins and vaccines needed for his hogs

location.town: Brgy. Mangayang, Dupax del Sur, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en:
Bernadette is 29 years old and a married woman with two children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Bernadette has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines. Bernadette requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more dried fish to sell.

Bernadette has been in this business for two years. In the future, Bernadette would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Ella

texts.en:
Ella is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Ella successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Ella's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is 28 years old and a married woman with two children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Elsie has a fishing business in the Philippines. Elsie requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Elsie has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Elsie would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 31 years old and married with three children.  With one child in school, Gemma works very hard to provide for her family.

She runs a buy and sell nipa roofing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional nipa to sell.

Gemma has been in this business for 3 years. 

In the future Gemma would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional nipa to sell

loans.name: Bahriniso

texts.ru: Бахриниссо прекрасная женщина, ей 32 лет. Она заботливая  жена и  мать четырех детей. Бахринисо очень  добросовестная и трудолюбивая женщина. Они всей семьей занимаются колхозным хозяйством. На своем участке земли они выращивают разные  овощи и зерно. Потом собирают все и относят  в рынок для продажи. Вот так они зарабатывает на жизнь для проживание. В прошлом сезоне они получили от урожая хороший доход и отремонтировали свой дом. В этом году ее муж хочет уезжать за границу на заработки потому что в конце текущего года у них намечается мероприятие и у них нет пока наличных средств. Поэтому Бахриниссо  обратилась в Арванд за получение кредита для покупки авиабилета для мужа и заранее благодарить Арванд за поддержку и понимание!!!
texts.en: Bahriniso, age 32, is a wonderful woman.  She is a caring wife and the mother of four children.  She is also a very conscientious and hardworking woman.  Her entire family works on a collective farm.  On their allotted plot of land, they grow various vegetables and grains.  After the harvest, they send their crops for resale at the market. This is how Bahriniso and her family make a living.  Over the last season, they made a good income from the harvest and they were able to renovate their house.  This year, Bahriniso's husband wants to go abroad and work as a migrant worker.  The family has a big celebration coming up at the end of the year, but so far they don't have enough money to pay for it.  For this reason, Bahriniso has turned to Arvand and requested a loan to buy a plane ticket for her husband.  She thanks them in advance for their support and understanding!!!

loans.use: to buy a plane ticket for her husband.

loans.name: Chhon

texts.en: Chhon is 39 year old married factory worker with two children, who lives in the Kampong Chhnang province in Cambodia. She has been working in the factory for four years, making about 5 USD per day. Her two children are in school. Her husband is 50 years old and works as a security guard, earning around 4 USD each day. Chhon is applying for a loan because she would like to buy construction materials to build a bathroom with a toilet for her family's use. This loan will provide her and her family with hygienic living conditions. In the future, Chhon plans to buy farmland to cultivate rice and support her two children to go through high school.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to build a bathroom with a toilet

loans.name: Paular

texts.en:
Paular is grateful that she was granted a Php 24000 PHP loan that she used buy fruits and vegetables to sell. Her earnings help support her family and meet their daily basic needs.

She would like now to apply for a Php 25000 loan, which she will use to buy more fruits and vegetables, such as bananas, jack fruit, Indian mango, eggplant, string beans, and cabbage to sell at her fruit/vegetable stand. She is positive that her earnings will increase as she expands her business. She is thanking God and you in advance for a good return on her investment and the financial help that will be given her for it will surely cover their everyday basic needs and helps support her grandchildren's schooling. 

Paula dreams that her business will be more successful. She prays for good health and long life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

. * All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To purchase fruits and vegetables to sell at her fruit stand.

loans.name: Harold

texts.en: Harold is 44 years old, married and has two children attending school. Being a responsible father, he aims to educate his children so that they will be the ones to help them when they get old. Due to high cost of commodities and school fees, he cannot afford to finance all their schooling. For this reason, he would like to access educational assistance amounting to PHP 20,000.00 to pay the tuition fee, school uniforms, books and allowances of his son. He hopes that his requested amount will be granted to enable him to support the education of his son.

loans.use: to pay the tuition fee, school uniforms, books and allowances of his son

location.town: Brgy. Malasin, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Analy

texts.en:
Analy is 38 years old and married with seven children. With three of her children currently in school, Analy works very hard to provide for them.

Analy runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like canned goods, snack foods, coffee, sugar, soft drinks, beer, etc. to sell.

Analy has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, snack foods, coffee, sugar, soft drinks, beers, etc. 

In the future, Analy would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items like canned goods, snack foods, coffee, sugar, soft drinks, and beer to sell

loans.name: Ourokaal Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de femmes appartenant à une même communauté de base. Elles ont toujours remboursé leur prêt sans difficultés. Madame Rosalie qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est la représentante du groupe. Elle est mariée âgée de 60 ans et mère de 3 garçons. Elle s'active dans la vente de beignets depuis plus de 20 ans. C'est une activité qu'elle maitrise très bien et a un nombre important de clients qui achètent sur commande. Les bénéfices vont servir à améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille(nourriture, santé, habillement)etc...
texts.en:
This group is made up of women who all come from the same community.  They have always repaid their loans on time and without problems.

Rosalie (on the right in the photo, with her hand raised) is the group representative.  She is sixty years old, married and has three sons.  She has been selling fritters for more than twenty years.  She is very good at their preparation and she has a great many clients who place orders with her.

Her profits will be used to improve the living conditions of Rosalie's family (food, healthcare, clothing, etc.).

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make fritters for sale.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene works hard to support her family. Arlene is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Arlene requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients like fish, vegetables, spices, meat, etc. for her food production business.

Arlene has been in this business for 23 years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Arlene would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like fish, vegetables, spices, and meat for her food production business

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is 52 years old and married with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Carmelita has a weaving business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more raw materials for her business. She has been in this business for 8 years. 

She would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase more raw materials for her business

loans.name: Arney

texts.en:
Arney is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Arney is 42 years old and two of her children are currently in school.

Arney has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

Arney has been in this business for four years. In the future, Arney would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Susan is 53 years old and has one child still in school.

Susan has a farming of vegetables business in the Philippines. Susan requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fertilizers, seeds, organic and other farm supplies.

Susan has been in this business for five years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizers, seeds, organic and other farm supplies

loans.name: Chhany

texts.en: Chhany is a 19-year-old son in a family who lives in the Prey Veng Province in Cambodia. He is pursuing a bachelor’s degree, majoring in medicine in the first year at university in the province. His parents are farmers. Chhany is requesting a loan because he lacks the finances to pay his tuition fees from the first to the third year. This loan will help him graduate successfully and earn skills to achieve his future goal. In the future, Chhany hopes to run his own clinic.

loans.use: to pay his tuition fees

loans.name: Anora

texts.en:
Anora is a hardworking woman. She was born in 1990 and is from the northern part of the country, and she lives in a remote district. She is a powerful, honest, brave and hospitable person. She has now remarried and has three children. Her husband helps to do business with her. He supports Anora with finance and with his own labor. 

For about ten years, Anora has been doing business through agriculture. She keeps livestock and works on the land with plantings. Her first startup business was selling dairy products. She sold dairy products by knocking at each neighbor’s door and offering her products. It was hard for her to do business in the beginning, but she has successfully passed through the hard times of building a business. 

Now Anora is asking for financial support to increase her turnover, and she would like to be supported by a KIVA project. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, corn, and horned cattle

loans.name: Zarofat

texts.en:
Zarofat is 50 years old and lives in the Shahrituz district with her family. 

She is asking for her first loan from Humo. She has one calf at home, and with the loan amount she would like to purchase more cattle and start a business. Her husband helps her, and Zarofat hopes that her new business will improve their living conditions. Currently she does not have any money, but she believes that with the help of Kiva lenders she can fulfill her dream. 

In the future, Zarofat wants to continue her partnership with Humo.

loans.use: To purchase more cattle and start a new business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy various products for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy various products for resale.

loans.name: Novalita

texts.en: Novalita is 33 years old and married. She helps her husband generate income by buying and reselling fruits and vegetables within their locality. She and her husband aspire to improve their status of living in order to give their family a better life. She aims to continue to improve her business but she does not have enough capital. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy more ginger, tomatoes, beans, cabbages and bananas to resell. A kind and hard working mother, she believes that she will improve her business more through this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy more ginger, tomatoes, beans, cabbages and bananas to resell.

location.town: Brgy. Ineangan, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Belles Dames Group

texts.fr: Lata est une veuve qui se bat au quotidien pour s'occuper de ses enfants et leur assurer un avenir. Elle a 4 enfants tous scolarisés. Elle vend la boisson et elle a besoin de ce crédit pour s'approvisionner en boisson pour revendre en  détail à ses clients. A l'aide de son commerce, elle arrive a prendre soin de ses enfants en les nourrissant, en les soignant en cas de maladie,etc. A l'issue de ses ventes, elle pourra avoir un bénéfice qui lui permettra de continuer son activité et surtout de s'occuper de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Lata is a widow who battles on a daily basis to take care of her children and provide them with a future.  She has four children, all of whom attend school.  She sells soft drinks and will use her loan to buy more supplies to sell to her customers.

Through her business, Lata will be able to look after her children and pay for food, healthcare, etc.

When she sells her drinks, she will make a profit and be able to continue her business and support her children.

loans.use: to buy drinks for resale.

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es: Reina muy contenta y agradecida por los tres apoyos anteriormente brindados para poder asistir sus cultivos de café y granos básicos en las temporadas anteriores, mejoro con cada uno de ellos la producción, la calidad, la plantación, el volumen y demás aspectos que con las ventas sus resultados fueron satisfactorios. Su primer crédito lo invirtió en la compra de abonos, foliares, fertilizantes entre otros para asistir sus cultivos de café. Con su segundo crédito destino parte del primer crédito y algunos insumos para poder asistir sus cultivos de maíz y frijol con los cuales obtuvo muy buenas ganancias al momento de la venta. Su tercer crédito fue nuevamente invertido en la compra de insumos agrícolas para asistir nuevamente sus cultivos de café saliendo antes del tiempo establecido de su compromiso de pago. En esta nueva ocasión ella solicita su cuarto crédito para poder hacer compras de abonos, foliares, fertilizantes, plaguicidas entre otros y asistir nuevamente sus cultivos de café en esta nueva temporada dando a los mismos un excelente mantenimiento y cuidado para poder obtener una cosecha exitosa y llena de muchos beneficios por lo cual espera ser apoyada en esta nueva ocasión.
texts.en:
Reina is very happy and grateful for the support she received for her coffee crop and basic grains in previous seasons.  The crop production, quality, planting and volume all improved, as well as the sales aspects which were satisfactory.  She used her first loan to buy manures, leaf treatments, fertilizers and other supplies for her coffee crop.  The second loan was used to buy supplies for her corn and bean crops which earned a good profit at sales time.  She invested her third loan in farm supplies to attend to her coffee crop and paid back her loan ahead of time.

On this new occasion, Reina is requesting her fourth loan to buy manures, leaf treatments, fertilizers, insecticides and other supplies for her coffee crop.  In this new season she wants to provide excellent maintenance and care for a successful, profitable harvest.  She hopes to receive your support once again.

loans.use: To buy manures, leaf treatments, insecticides and other supplies for her coffee crop.

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
SIRA est la dame qui est assise avec le mouton juste devant elle sur la photo.                                                                                                                Sira est une éleveuse malienne âgée de 55 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de six enfants dont trois vont à l’école. L’âge des enfants se détermine entre 8 et 17ans. Son mari est un mécanicien de vélo. 
Elle fait recourt au RMCR par ce qu’elle n’a pas assez de moyen pour développer son activité d’élevage. Avec le prêt de l’institution elle pourra avoir assez de chèvres dans son pâturage ce qui lui permettra de produire plus de bénéfice pour aider son mari au charge de la famille. Elle s’approvisionne dans les marchés locaux et revend dans les mêmes marchés locaux.
Exerçant cette activité depuis plus de 10 ans elle désira avoir des formations professionnelles pour pouvoir mieux connaître son activité.
texts.en:
Sira is sitting with the sheep in front of her in the photo.  She is 55 years old, Malian, married and mother to six children, three of whom currently attend school.  Her children are aged between eight and seventeen years.  Sira's husband is a bicycle mechanic.

Sira has begun working with the field partner, RMCR, as she does not have sufficient funds to develop her business.  She intends to use her loan to buy enough goats to generate a bigger profit so she can help her husband provide for the expenses of their family.  

Sira buys her livestock at the local markets and resells them at the same markets.  She has more than ten years' experience in her business and would now like to undergo some professional training to improve her knowledge.

loans.use: to buy sheep to fatten up and then sell on.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy various items for resale.

loans.name: Tuyến

texts.en:
Mrs. Tuyến works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

Tuyến is 46 years old, and she is married with two children. She lives and works in Quang Xuong district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with one dependent.

In 2015, Tuyến joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Tuyến has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main hardship that Tuyến faces in her life is not having a hygeinic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Tuyến hopes for her business to do well. She also hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, and to travel for vacation within the country.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

loans.name: Mizhgona

texts.en:
Mizhgona was born in 1995 and lives in the southern part of the country in a village. She is single and lives with her parents.

Mizhgona is a brave woman, and she came to the city to get a higher education as she had dreamt since childhood of working as a teacher. Now she is a second year student studying pedagogy at university. 

Unfortunately her parents didn't save any money, even for Mizhgona’s education, so she hopes that this Kiva project will support her financially. She has requested a loan for the payment of her university tuition fees.

loans.use: To pay tuition fees for university

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy food ingredients for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy food ingredients for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Holbibi

texts.en:
Holbibi is a hardworking woman and lives in her own house with her family. She sews traditional clothes for a living and works from home. She makes a variety of different items of clothing and sells them at very affordable prices. Her work is of good quality, which is why many people come to her. She has worked in this field for many years and has a lot of experience as well as loyal customers who keep coming back to her. 

Holbibi has decided to request a loan from Kiva in order to invest in her small business and buy supplies, such as fabric, thread, elastic and needles to make clothing and to generate more income. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as fabric, thread, elastic, and needles.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma engages in selling mats, ready-to-wear, kitchen materials, and other household items. She is a resident in the town of Talibon, Bohol. She is a 39-year-old married woman with three children aged 16,14, and 11. Her husband has a small business that will help defray the family's daily expenses.
She is asking for a loan to buy kitchen wares like pots, and other household materials. This will allow her to improve the variety of her merchandise, and it could attract more buyers. This will help to generate more sales and allow her to balance her finances. She could then afford to provide her family with nutritious food and better living conditions.
Vilma hopes to become a successful business woman someday which will help improve her family's livelihood status.

loans.use: to buy kitchen wares like pots, and other household materials

loans.name: Mirian Mercedes

texts.es:
En  el sector conocido como La 12 De Marzo  de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen  cada quince días las socias  del Grupo De Crédito El Nuevo Paraíso # 1. Lugar de gente humilde y dedicada a la agricultura y al comercio en general.
En este lugar vive la señora Mirian, tiene 38 años de edad, está separada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos de  15, 9 y 5 años de edad, el mayor estudia en colegio y los menores en escuela.
Doña Miriam e una mujer que le gusta trabajar y con sus ganancias salir adelante ella con sus hijos, ella se dedica al comercio, vende productos Avon y Yanbal  (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas), su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella también en sociedad con otras señoras del lugar preparan y venden tongas( arroz con gallina criolla, envuelto en hojas de plátano), ella  trabaja casi todos los días en sus actividades ya que de alguna forma tiene que lograr sus ingresos para darles lo necesario a sus hijos ya que ella es madre y padre a la vez. 
Este crédito es  para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y víveres para preparar las tongas. Lleva 2 años en el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos sale adelante. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank named “El Nuevo Paraíso #1” (New Paradise #1) meets every 15 days in the March 12th neighborhood in the city of Portoviejo. The humble and dedicated people who live in this place engage in agriculture and general trade.

Sra. Mirian lives in this area. She is 38 years old, separated from her spouse, and has three children (ages 15, 9, and 5). Her oldest child is in high school and the younger ones attend elementary school.

Doña Mirian is a woman who enjoys working. With the income she earns, she is able to move forward along with her children. She engages in trade by selling Avon and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and women’s accessories). Mirian conducts her sales by going door-to-door. She also partners with other local women in preparing and selling “tongas” (chicken and rice wrapped in banana leaves). Mirian works just about every day in these business activities. This allows her to earn income so that she can provide for her children’s needs since she performs the role of both mother and father at the same time.

This loan will be used to buy perfumes, crèmes, cosmetics, and ingredients for making “tongas”. Mirian has been with the Communal Bank for two years and enjoys being a member because the loans have allowed her to get ahead. Her dreams include providing the best for her children.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for making "tongas", as well as perfumes, crèmes, and cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Orlando

texts.en: Orlando helps his wife uplift their living condition by engaging in a livestock business. Orlando runs a hog-raising business, particularly hogs for breeding. He has been running the business for over 14 years. Orlando is married and has two children sending to school. He needs to be patience and strive in able to give the better way of living for his family. Due to the successive needs of his children in school, Orlando can’t sustain both his children's needs and his hog feed requirement at the same time. To this end, Orlando is asking for a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy feed for the maintenance of his hogs. He will use his revenue to meet his children's needs in school.

loans.use: to buy feed for the maintenance of his hogs.

loans.name: Dionela

texts.en:
Dionela is 51 years old and married with two children who are still in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Dionela runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy items such as canned goods, personal care products, shampoo, noodles and soft drinks to sell. She has been in this business for 3 years. She would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items such as canned goods, personal care products, shampoo, noodles and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Elena

texts.en:
Ma. Elena is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ma. Elena is 45 years old and has four children who are still in school.

Ma. Elena has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 30,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more sacks of rice to sell.

Ma. Elena has been in this business for four years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Froilan

texts.es:
Froilan es un señor muy trabajador, vive junto a su esposa, hijas y nietos en la ciudad de Santo Domingo de los Colorados, habitan en un humilde hogar que con el esfuerzo diario han podido obtener durante varios años.
Froilan a pesar de no contar con recursos necesarios y vivir en un hogar humilde, cría a una nieta como si fuera su hija, ya que sus propios padres por falta de dinero no han podido darle la educación y se la entregaron a esta bella familia.
Froilan es un señor trabajador y luchador, actualmente  trabaja en las noches como guardia de seguridad en una empresa y por las mañanas ayuda a su esposa en la preparación de empanadas ya que ella recorre a vender. Son conocidos ene l sector ya que su esposa por temporadas también vende comida. Froilan ahora necesita ponerse un negocio más estable, por ello con su esposa han planificado desde hace varios meses emprender en el negocio de la venta de comida. Acudieron a Fundacion Alternativa y con este crédito ellos podrán comprar un coche básico para la preparación de almuerzos y meriendas, ya que cuentan con ollas y con la vajilla necesaria para comenzar.
Froilan y toda su familia se siente agradecida con la institución y con Kiva por hacer realidad su pequeño sueño, están muy seguros que crecerán como microemrpesarios y podrán salir adelante con la ayuda de toda su familia.
texts.en:
Froilan is a very hard worker who lives with his wife, daughters and grandchildren in the city of Santo Domingo de los Colorados.  They live in a humble house which they were able to obtain through several years of hard work.

Despite having insufficient resources and living in humble conditions, Froilan raises his granddaughter as if she were his daughter, since her own parents cannot afford to give her an education.  Therefore she is being raised by this wonderful family.

Froilan is a hard-working, determined man who currently works at night as a security guard for a company.  In the morning he helps his wife prepare meat pies which she goes out to sell.  They are known in the area because his wife also sells food.  Since Froilan now needs to establish a more stable business, he and his wife have been planning for several months to start their own food business.

They have requested a loan through Fundación Alternativa to buy a basic cart to prepare foods for morning and afternoon meals, since they have the pans and dishes they need to start.

Froilan and all his family are grateful to the institution and Kiva for making his small dream a reality.  They are sure they will grow as small business owners and will be able to get ahead with the help of all the family.

loans.use: To buy a cart to prepare morning and afternoon meals.

loans.name: Jose  Israel

texts.es: Jose de 39 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus padres, el se dedica al cultivo de maíz, su padre le ayuda con las siembras, el tiene 15 años de dedicarse a esta actividad el cual inicio con ayuda siempre de su padre, comercializa sus productos en los pueblos aledaños, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semilla, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. asi como muestra en la fotografía para poder seguir con su trabajo y tener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Jose is 39 years old and lives in his own home with his parents. He works growing maize, and his father helps him with planting. He has been doing this activity for 15 years, and got started with it with his father's help.

Jose sells his products in surrounding towns. With his sales, he is able to cover some of his household's expenses. Jose is requesting a loan in order to purchase seeds, fertilizers, manure, insecticides, etc. like those shown in the photograph, so that he can continue his work and improve his income.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, manure, insecticides, etc.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia tiene 52 años de edad, es casada, sin hijos a su cargo, vive con su familia en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

Julia se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales como patos, gallos, gallinas, pollos, cuyes con más de 20 años de experiencia en el negocio, el mismo que está ubicado en la parte posterior de su domicilio. Ella solicita préstamo para compra de un número mayor de animales, dicha inversión le servirá para tener mayor variedad y productividad en animales, con gran influencia en el negocio; Julia piensa incrementar su stock de animales para poder atender los diversos gustos y necesidades de los clientes de la zona, lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Julia is 52 years old, married, and has no children under her care. She lives with her family in a rural area in the District of Oyotún in Chiclayo Province. This community is in the region of Lambayeque on the northern coast of Peru. The residents engage in agriculture, livestock breeding, and trade.

Julia raises and sells animals such as ducks, roosters, hens, chicks, and guinea pigs. She has more than 20 years of experience in this business. Julia raises the animals in an area behind her home. She is requesting a loan in order to buy a large number of animals. This investment will allow her to have greater variety and more productivity from her animals, which will have a great influence on her business. Julia believes that increasing her inventory of animals will allow her to fulfill the different tastes and needs of her customers in the area. In the short term this will improve her earnings, increase her income, and eventually improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy a large number of animals.

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is a married woman with one child who attends school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Mwanaisha operates a vegetable stall, which she sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces the challenge of the high cost of transportation to her place of operation. 

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions to resell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions to resell.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is 55 years old and has five children. She is married and one of her children is still in school.
Angelina is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. Angelina requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy sacks of feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pigs.
Angelina has been in business for 10 years now, and she has borrowed 8 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.
She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Nelly Margarita

texts.es:
Nelly Margarita vive junto a su hija en la ciudad de Santo Domingo de los Colorados, habitan en un humilde hogar que con el esfuerzo diario ha podido obtener durante varios años.
Nelly a pesar de no contar con el padre de su hija ella ha sacado adelante a su familia; trabaja todos los días en una empresa donde pela camarón, lleva muchos años ahí; ya en las tardes mientras su hija regresa de la escuela ella dedica tiempo a su negocio, se dedica a la crianza de pollos, les da el alimento y limpia el pequeño criadero. Comenta Nelly que gracias a este negocio ella ha podido darle la educación a su pequeña porque con el poco ingreso de la empresa en donde trabaja no le alcanza par5a cubrir todos sus gastos.
Nelly es una señora muy humilde y muy trabajadora,  con el crédito obtenido podrá comprar más pollitos y balanceado, quiere crecer en su negocio ya que se está dando a conocer más. Se siente feliz y agradecida con todos los miembros de la institución por permitir que salga adelante apoyándola.
texts.en:
Nelly Margarita lives with her daughter in the city of Santo Domingo de los Colorados.  They live in a humble house which they were able to obtain after several years of hard work.

Despite not being able to count on the father of her daughter for help, Nelly has been able to provide for the family.  She works every day at a company where she has been peeling shrimp for several years.  In the afternoons, while her daughter comes home from school, she spends time with her business raising chickens.  She feeds them and keeps the pen clean.  Nelly says that thanks to this business she has been able to give her daughter an education, because the small income she earns at the company does not cover all her expenses.

Nelly is a very humble, hard-working woman.  With the loan she will buy more chickens and balanced feed.  She wants to grow the business since it is becoming more popular.  She is happy and grateful to all the members of the institution who are allowing her to support herself and get ahead.

loans.use: To buy more chickens and balanced feed to grow her business.

loans.name: Ozod

texts.ru: Озод мужчина в возрасте  28 лет родился и вырос в семьи мастера. Озод женат имеет одного ребёнка который недавно родился. Озод имеет среднее образование. Озод живет в домике которого сам в месте с отцом построили . Озод в месте женой живет душа в душе. Озод является  плотником. Он занимается этим делом уже  5 лет и знает все тонкости этой деятельности. Озод имеет свой собственный цех. Озод обратился МДО Арванд для получение кредита для ремонт своего жилья. Он очень благодарен МДО Арванд и признателен, заранее благодарит за поддержку и доверие.
texts.en: Ozod is 28 years old.  He was born and grew up in a foreman's family.  He is married and has a new-born baby. Ozod has a secondary education.  He lives in a small house which he and his father built themselves.  He and his wife get along very well.  Ozod is a carpenter.  He has been working in this field for five years and he knows his job inside out.  He has his own workshop.  He has turned to MDO Arvand to receive a loan to renovate his house.  He is very thankful to MDO Arvand and he wishes to thank them in advance for their support and their trust.

loans.use: to renovate his house.

loans.name: Maria Francisca

texts.es:
María, de 56 años de edad, creció con sus padres, estudio hasta cuarto grado, se acompañó hace 8 años y su pareja se trabaja como seguridad en una empresa en la ciudad, es madre de 7 hijos, tres de ellos aún están en su casa y también dos nietos, quienes están estudiando.
