Maria comes from a very tenacious family.  With effort and sacrifice from her parents, she has been reaching her goals.

She is studying for a postgraduate degree in Holistic Posture Rehabilitation [methods for physical therapy].  This means she will be learning and improving her knowledge in order to be able to help others.

She is happy about the opportunity she is getting to be able to continue improving and growing.  She is requesting this loan to be able to make educational payments.  With this she will be able to continue with her education as she has been doing.

loans.use: to make university payments.

loans.name: Pak

texts.en:
Pak is a 51-year-old married rice farmer with two grownup children; she lives in the Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. She has cultivated rice since 2000. Her husband is 62 years old and he is also a rice farmer. Her two children work in a garment factory. Together, they can make around USD 12 per day. 

Now Pak would like to request a loan to buy more farmland to cultivate rice. This loan will help her have enough finances to buy more farmland and gain more rice crops. 

Pak is going to buy soil to fill the yard around her house.

loans.use: to buy more farmland to cultivate rice

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay university tuition and pay for make-up exams.

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en:
Hadija is a married mother of five children, all of whom graduated from school and are working. They live at their own house that has electricity and piped water. 

For years, she has operated a food stall business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She also operates a business of renting houses in the town. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in all her businesses.
 
With the 100,000 KES, she wants to purchase three bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase three bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar

loans.name: Philemon

texts.en:
Philemon is married and has three children. He provides for his family through mixed farming. In 2006, Philemon started farming on two acres, which he received from his mother. The activities on the farm has grown ever since. Philemon's farm now has two dairy cows, five heads of poultry, 20 trees, maize plants, and hay.

Philemon is requesting a loan for 30,000 KES, which he will use to increase the number of poultry on his farm. With more heads of poultry, he will have more products and byproducts to offer at the market. The increase in income will help him meet the basic needs of his family.

loans.use: to purchase poultry

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy gasoline and spare parts needed for the maintenance of his truck

loans.name: San Miguel Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado San Miguel y está en su 1er ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, para poder conocer la situación de vida de cada una y conforme a ello poder trabajar por mejorar.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Julia quien en su encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza mostró estar en un nivel extremo de pobreza, pero ella no se deja vencer, ya que por medio de las capacitaciones y su pequeño emprendimiento podrá ir mejorando cada día. Ella tiene una despensa en la que trabaja todos los días desde muy tempranas horas del día, hasta muy tarde. Es una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora.
Ella está mejorando poco a poco y es por ello que pide este préstamo para poder mejorar cada día, y para poder comprar frutas, verduras, carne, panificados, bebidas y otros, para poder seguir con su sacrificio y esfuerzo.
texts.en: The group called "San Miguel" is in their first loan cycle In the Woman's Committee Program. All of them are taking part in the Poverty Stoplight Survey to be able to know each members' life situation and be able to work to better it. One of the members is Julia who in the Poverty Stoplight survey was at an extreme poverty level. But she has not given up as through the training and her small enterprise she has been able to improve each day. She has a store where she works daily from very early in the morning until late. She is a very hard-working person and a fighter. She is improving little by little and for this reason she is requesting a loan to buy fruit, vegetables, meat, breads, drinks and others to continue with her sacrifice and effort.

loans.use: to buy fruits, meat, breads, drinks and others.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is a 55-year-old married woman with three dependents. Nida lives in Leyte, Philippines. She earns a living through her sari-sari or retail store business. Nida sells goods like food items and dry goods. She has been in the business for more than five years now. 

Nida is a asking to take a loan to buy more merchandise to sell like rice, canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, candies, bread and biscuits, detergents, condiments and cooking oil. 

This loan will enable Nida to improve her stock, thus attracting more customers to buy in her store. 

In the future, Nida hopes to make her store business a success and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to sell like rice, canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, candies, bread and biscuits, detergents, condiments and cooking oil

loans.name: Meliza

texts.en:
Meliza, is aged 29, is married and they're blessed with two children. She has owned and managed a food stall inside the school campus for almost five years, and earns a net income of PHP 2,000 a week. 

Due to insufficient capital in her business, she would like to avail a loan amounting to PHP 9,000 to purchase cooking oil, sugar, evaporated milk, flour, noodles, and food ingredients to use in her business. 

She's hoping that her business will continue to improve and become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase cooking oil, sugar, evaporated milk, flour, noodles, and food ingredients to use in her business.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a 46-year-old lady from the Chuka area of Kenya and is into dairy farming. Milk is her chief source of income. She uses the income that she makes from dairy farming to help her husband, whom she has been married to for five years, to provide for their three children. 

As her kids grow bigger, Esther's responsibility to provide also grows. And, with 22 years of experience in farming, the only way she can increase her income is through investing large sums of money (that she doesn't have) to acquire more cows. It is for that reason that she is turning to Kiva lenders to inject a loan to invest in her dairy business. 

With your loan, Esther will buy an additional dairy cow which will produce more milk to sell. Income from the investment will enable Esther to keep up with the growing family expenses.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a Solar Home Solution

loans.name: Tangni Lotty

texts.es: TANGNI LOTTY: Es una mujer joven luchadora, originaria de Puerto Cabezas, pertenece a la etnia Miskita, tiene 24 años de edad, casada con un pequeño hijo de 1 año de edad. Desde hace 3 años alquila un cuarto, pagando una mensualidad de C$700 (Setecientos Córdobas Netos). Con el propósito de tener su propia vivienda, solicita su primer financiamiento para comprar un terreno y poco a poco iniciarla construcción de su vivienda de tambo y madera, para brindarle a su familia una vivienda segura y propia. Ella y su esposo sueñan con tener una vivienda que les brinde las condiciones necesarias para vivir dignamente.
texts.en:
Tangni Lotty is a hardworking young woman. She is from Puerto Cabezas and belongs to the Miskita ethnic group. She is 24 years old, married, and has a one-year old son.

For the last three years she has rented a room for which she pays C$700 (700 córdobas) monthly. As Tangni Lotty wishes to have a house of her own, she is seeking her first loan to buy land. Then over time she will build a wooden stilt home so her family will have a comfortable home of their own. She and her husband dream of a house which will provide them with the necessary conditions for a dignified life.

loans.use: buy land and later build a wooden stilt home

loans.name: Vardan

texts.en:
Vardan is from Kapan, Syunik region where he lives with his mother, wife and two children. 

Vardan is the only breadwinner of the family; he is involved in construction. Besides construction work, Vardan also works as a driver for a local company using his own truck. 

When he started to provide construction work two years ago, he could only afford to purchase low-cost materials and tools. However, thanks to his hard work, Vardan was able to get enough profit to take care of his family and expand his work. 

Vardan is asking for this loan to purchase new tools and materials to provide construction work and also to pay for the renovation of his truck. 

His loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides business start-up loans to informal businesses that do not qualify through normal channels.

loans.use: to purchase new tools and materials to provide construction work and also to pay for the renovation of his truck.

loans.name: Las Hermosas Flores Group

texts.es:
Lorencia de 37 años de edad soltera, con un hijo menor. Hace tres años Lorencia se dedica a la venta de anticuchos al costado de su casa. Paralelo a este negocio también se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza y ropas de catálogo. Con sus ingresos de su venta  diaria solventa los gastos de su hogar. El sueño de Lorencia es tener un local propio para su negocio y poder brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo.  El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de insumos (aceite) y compra de ropas de catálogos y tener como stock. Lorencia es la que esta sentada a lado izquierdo de la foto.
Está muy contenta de haber recibido el apoyo de los inversionistas Kiva.
texts.en:
Lorencia is 37 years old, single, and has one young son. For 3 years she has made a living selling "anticuchos" (kebobs) beside her house. In parallel with this business, she also sells beauty products and clothing though catalogs. With her income from sales, she is able to cover the household expenses.

Lorencia's dream is to have her own space for her business and provide a better quality of life to her son. She will invest the loan in the purchase of supplies, such as oils, and additionally in purchasing clothing catalogs.

Lorencia is the person sitting on the left in the photo. She is very happy to receive the support of Kiva investors.

loans.use: to buy supplies (oil) and clothing catalogs.

loans.name: Lorelie

texts.en:
Lorelie is 30 years old and has young children she is sending to school. She manages a store. Lorelie earns an income selling groceries to the people in her village. 

Lorelie is requesting a 5,000 PHP loan to buy canned goods, noodles, soap, and shampoo to sell. Someday, she hopes to offer better services and acquire good profits from her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, soap and shampoo to sell

loans.name: Veyena

texts.en:
Veyena is a 34-year-old married woman and a mother of three children from Leyte, Philippines. For more than five years, she has owned a fishing pond business where she raises tilapia. 

Veyena is requesting a loan to buy more nets and fish feed. Her loan will help her improve her business and her income. Veyena wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy nets and fish feed

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa is a married woman and a mother of a five-year-old child. She is from Leyte, Philippines, where she has been raising hogs for more than three years now. This is Luisa’s source of income. 

Luisa is requesting a loan to buy additional piglets to raise and to buy animal feed. Her loan will help her improve her business as well as increase her income. Luisa’s future dreams include the expansion of her business and saving money for the schooling of her child.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and piglets to raise

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es: MARISOL: Es una señora sonriente, cordial de amable43 años de edad, Originaria de Puerto Cabezas. Madre soltera de 6 hijos: 2 son mayores de edad e independiente y 4 en edad escolar. Desde hace 10 años vive en una casa de tambo y madera. Solicita financiamiento para cambiar la madera, comprar materiales de construcción: madera cepillada, clavos y cubrir costos de mano de obra. Su sueño es construir su casa de concreto (cemento) para que sus hijos vivan de manera segura.
texts.en: Marisol is a smiling, friendly, kind 43 year old woman and a native of Puerto Cabezas. She is a single mother of 6 children, 2 are adults and independent and 4 are school age children.  For 10 years she has lived in a stilt home made of wood. She is asking for the loan to replace the wood, buy construction materials: planed wood, nails and to cover the cost of manual labor.  Her dream is to build a cement house so that her children live in a safe place.

loans.use: to replace the wood, buy construction materials: planed wood, nails and to cover the cost of manual labor.

loans.name: Mehafruz

texts.ru:
Мехрафруз молодая женщина 30 лет. Она замужем и имеет двоих детей. Она  учится в педагогическом колледже на 5 курсе в заочном отделение. Мехрафруз очень хорошая портниха. Она очень хорошо и красиво  шьет модные  платья для женщин и подростоков.  Её очень  уважают соседи и близкие. Ее муж работает плотником.
 Мехрафруз  обратилась в Арванд за кредитом. Она хочет оплатить договор своего обучения. Она очень надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en:
Mehafruz is a 30-year old woman. She is married and has two children. She is in her last year of studies at Teachers’ College, in the distance education division. Mehafruz is an excellent seamstress. She sews beautiful fashionable dresses for women and teens. She is well respected in her community. 
Her husband works as a carpenter. 

Mehafruz has applied to Arvand for a loan to pay her college tuition. She really hopes for a positive outcome and thanks Arvand in advance for its financial support.

loans.use: to pay for education.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is 30 years old and has young children to provide for. She is always happy to be with her family. Nilda works selling snacks. 

Nilda is requesting a 5,000 PHP loan to buy more products to sell such as fish balls, hotdogs, and kikiam. Her loan will help increase her income and improve her business. In the future, Nilda hopes to continue providing for the needs of her family and achieve financial stability.

loans.use: to buy fish balls, hotdogs and kikiam to sell

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is 46 years old, married, and has four children. 

She is selling snacks to the people in her village. She wanted to increase her earnings, so she is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy cooking oil, fishballs, and kikiam to sell. 

Someday, Rosalina hopes to sell more snacks, to increase her profits for her family.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, fishballs, and kikiam to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for labor and construction materials.

loans.name: Nhóm 2- An Thanhv2 Group

texts.en:
Teo is 65 years old and is married with two adult children who live separately from her. She works in the agricultural sector and earns about 400,000 VND monthly. Teo has been a member of the local Women's Union since 1973. Her husband got into a labor accident and his health is not good to work. Teo’s family is classified as a poor family and they cannot afford to have a sanitary latrine. 

Teo is requesting a loan to build a septic tank latrine to improve the health of her family members and prevent diseases commonly associated with unhygienic toilets. In this photo, Teo is pictured first from the right.

loans.use: to construct a sanitary latrine with a device for handwashing with soap

loans.name: Dario Leonel

texts.es:
Dario tiene 25 años de edad es soltero vive con su madre en Ventanas provincia de los Rios.
El se dedica a la agricultura y solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos para la siembra de maiz ya que gracias al mismo podra mejorar la produccion y sacar a delante a su madre por que el es el sustento de los dos. Las compras realiza en Ventanas, su sueño es comprarse un terreno en el cual poder sembrar mas y obtener mayores ingresos, los desafios a los que se enfrenta es las enfermedades a los sembrios, y en su tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Dario is 25 years old, single, and lives with his mom in Ventanas in the province of Los Rios. He makes a living in agriculture and is asking for a loan to purchase supplies in Ventanas for planting corn, thereby improving production and allowing him to support and provide for his mother and himself.

His dream is to buy land in which he can plant more and obtain higher incomes. The challenges he faces are the various diseases that can strike the plants. In his spare time he likes to play sports.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for planting corn.

loans.name: Oscar Bladimir

texts.es:
Oscar tiene 43 años de edad tiene dos hijos de 14 y 12 años vive con ellos en Ventanas Provincia de Los Rios.

El se dedica a la agricultura y solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos y fertilizantes agricolas para sembrar maiz, ya que la facilidad del credito consedido podra ayudar a mejorar la producción del maiz con el mantenimiento adecuado y mejorar la economia, realiza las compras en Ventanas, su sueño es comprarse una máquina agrícola, los desafios a los que se enfrenta es las plagas en los sembrios y en su tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Oscar is 43 years old and has two children, ages 14 and 12, who live with them in Ventanas, De Los Rios Province.

Oscar is a farmer and he is requesting this loan to purchase agricultural inputs and fertilizers to sow corn. The facilities of the conceded loan would help improve his corn production, providing adequate maintenance and improved economy. He will make the purchases in Ventanas.

Oscar's dream is to buy agricultural machinery. The challenges he faces include crop plagues. 

In his spare time he enjoys sports.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural inputs and fertilizers for his corn crop.

loans.name: Cesiri N°1 Group

texts.fr: La dame qui a deux oignons en main sur la photo est Madié.  Madiè est une vendeuse Malienne âgée de 45 ans mariée, mère de 06 enfants dont 02 sont à l’école âgés de 15 à 19 ans. Son mari est un cultivateur qui n’a jamais été à l’école.Madiè a fréquenté école coranique. Elle vend des condiments (oignon, sel, Maggi, sou bala et d’autres ingrédients de sauce). Madiè a commencé ce travaille depuis 06 ans, elle n’a pas eu satisfaction dans le travail due à un problème de fond, Raison pour laquelle, elle a fait recourt au RMCR pour avoir de l argent pour son activité. Le profit qu’elle tire de son commerce de condiments lui permet de prendre certaines charges familiales (santé, éducation, habillements …. elle s’approvisionne de condiments, oignon, Maggi et beaucoup d’autre dans les marchés locaux et revend dans les mêmes marchés.
texts.en:
Madiè, age 45, is a reseller from Mali who is married with six children, two of them in school and aged 15 and 19. She is the member holding two onions in the group photo. Her husband is a farmer who never received formal schooling. Madiè herself went to Koranic school. She sells condiments (onions, salt, Maggi cubes, soumbala and other ingredients used in sauces). Madiè started this activity 6 years ago but was not successful due to a lack of funds, which is why she opted to partner with RMCR. She buys her stock at local markets and resells in the same locations.  

Her profits allow her to help with some of the family expenses (healthcare, tuition, clothing, etc.).

loans.use: to buy condiments for resale.

loans.name: Jose Rowel

texts.en:
Jose Rowel is a 49-year-old married man and a father of nine children from Leyte, Philippines. 

Jose Rowel is a fish vendor and has been in the business for more than a year now. Jose Rowel also earns an additional income through hollow-block making. 

Jose Rowel is asking to take a loan to buy more fish to sell. A loan will help Jose Rowel to improve his business as well as his income. 

Jose Rowel dreams of making his business successful and stable. Moreover, he wants to save money for the schooling of his children.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover his children's education expenses (uniforms and school supplies).

loans.name: Mashhura

texts.ru: Машхура замечательная и жизнерадостная женщина в возрасте 33 лет. Она замужняя женщина и имеет двоих прекрасных детей. Машхура работает в детском саду как воспитательница. Она очень общительная и честная женщина. У нее не плохой заработок но все же для осуществление своей потребности для улучшения условия своего проживания она не как не может, накопить денег. Вот уже несколько лет она планирует приобрести новую мебель и стиральную машину для уюта дома, но у нее недостаточно денежных средств и поэтому Машхура обратилась в Арванд, для получение кредита, что бы купить стиральную машину и мебель для уюта своего дома и заранее благодарить Арванд за поддержку!!!
texts.en: Mashhura is a wonderful, cheerful woman, aged 33. She is married and has two beautiful children. Mashhura is a kindergarten teacher. She is a very sociable and honest woman. She doesn't earn a bad living, but she cannot save money to improve her family's living conditions. She has been planning to buy new furniture and a washing machine to make her home more comfortable, but she does not have enough money. This is why Mashhura applied for a loan with Arvand and she thanks the organization in advance for supporting her!

loans.use: to buy a washing machine and furniture

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
La socia Isabel  se dedica al trabajo como profesora del nivel primario, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 2:00 p.m,la socia por medio de este trabajo quiere salir adelante, el sueño de la socia es tener una tienda de venta de ropa. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar un televisor para su casa.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member, Isabel, works as a primary school teacher. She works from 8:00 am until 2:00 pm and through this job she wants to get ahead. Her dream is to have a store to sell clothes.  

She is requesting the loan to buy a television for her house.  She is happy for the loan and she promises to make all the payments.

loans.use: to buy a television for her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
This is Evelyn. She is grateful for the 12,000 PHP loan that she received and used to purchase quantities of raw materials that she needed in making wallets. She also bought ingredients to produce more peanut butter items to sell. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household, and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 14,000 PHP loan to buy additional supplies of raw materials and ingredients needed in her businesses. Her profits will definitely help her to sustain her family’s daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Evelyn hopes that her children will finish their studies and she dreams to give them a good life. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from her religion.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who meet weekly to study religion, build social capital, and repay loans.

loans.use: to buy materials needed to make wallets and ingredients to make peanut butter.

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en: Liezel is a 37-year-old married woman and the mother of five children. She is from Leyte, Philippines and is engaged in selling salted fish in the market. Liezel has been in this business for more than three years now. Liezel is asking to take a loan to buy more fish. A loan will help her improve her business as well as her income. In the future, Liezel hopes to make her business more sustainable and productive. She also wants to save money for her children’s schooling.

loans.use: to buy more fish.

loans.name: Nyaga

texts.en:
Nyaga hails from a remote village in the central province of Kenya called Chuka. He has been married for a decade and is a father to two children aged 2 and 11. The older child is at a boarding school.
Nyaga runs a 0.75 acre mixed-farm where he practises poultry farming, rabbit farming and horticultural farming. He concentrates his efforts on horticulture because it is the source of both food and income for his family.
Nyaga is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders to grow more crops on his farm. To cultivate land, plant crops and look after them takes a lot of resources in terms of time, finances and effort. Nyaga has time and energy but lacks financial resources.
Your loan investment will dramatically increase his chances of achieving his goal of growing his horticultural farm. The impact of this investment will be strongly felt by his immediate family who heavily rely on their horticultural activities for food and income.

loans.use: to grow more crops

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en:
Gayane is 44 years old and lives in Kapan, Syunik region. In her house, Gayane makes big variety of pies and sandwiches.  She organizes the production from her house and the local school's canteen, where she also works as a cook. Gayane has an agreement with the local food stores. She cooks over the night and distributes produced products to the stores every morning. Her husband helps her a lot. It is his task to distribute products to the stores, using his own car. 

To continue her business, Gayane needs some funds. She asks for this loan to purchase food materials and to pay for the renovation of the car. Her loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides business start-up loans to informal businesses that do not qualify through normal channels.

Gayane has a dream of expanding her food production business and to start enlarging the variety of pies in the future. She hopes that lenders will support her loan to be funded.

loans.use: to pay for food materials and for the renovation of their car.

loans.name: Elmurod

texts.en: Elmurod is a creative, active, responsible and honest man. He lives in a remote district of Tajikistan. He was born into a poor family in 1994. His father has an agricultural business and serves clients as a master repairman. His mother has an agrarian business. Elmurod graduated from high school and entered the university. He tries to help his parents with finances, and every day after classes he works as a for-hire laborer to save money for his tuition fee at the university. This year he could not save up enough money, so Elmurod is asking for financial support to help pay his university tuition.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition.

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en:
Rogelio is a 53-year-old, married man and a father of eight children from Leyte, Philippines. Rogelio has been engaged in a fish vending business for more than 10 years now. He is standing next to his bicycle, which he uses to deliver fish to his customers. 

Rogelio is asking to take a loan to buy more fish to sell.  A loan will help him to make his business more profitable and successful. Moreover, he wants to save money to reinvest in the same business in the future, and to send his children to school.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Lorning

texts.en:
Lorning is 41 years old and from San Francisco, Baggao. She is married and blessed with two children. The family earns through farming, but what they earn is sometimes insufficient to send their daughter, Mia Grace, to college. Mia Grace is taking up a BS in Medical Technology. She is hopeful that she will easily find a stable job, so she can help her family. 

Lorning wants to continue sending Mia Grace to college. That’s why she wants to avail an education loan of PHP 7,000 from the KIVA lenders.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's tuition fees.

loans.name: Marquez

texts.en:
Marquez is a tricycle driver from Leyte, Philippines. He is 33 years old, married and has five children. Marquez has been in the business for more than five years now. He also earns additional income through a sari-sari or retail store and a hog raising business.
Marquez would like to avail a loan to pay for the repair and maintenance of his motorcycle and also to buy additional stocks for the store like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries among other things. This loan will help him improve his business as well as his income. In the future, Marquez has hopes of making his ventures more sustainable and profitable. Moreover, he also wants to save money for his children’s schooling.

loans.use: to pay for the repair and maintenance of his motorcycle and also to buy additional stocks for the store like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries among other things.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is 53 years old, married to a farmer. and they're blessed with two children. 

She's been into a direct selling business for almost two years in their village and earns a net income of PHP 600 weekly. 

Due to insufficient funds in her business, Melanie would like to avail herself of a loan, amounting to PHP 10,000, to purchase lotions, lingerie, perfumes, deodorant, body spray, clothes, and shoes to sell. 

She's hoping that her business will continue to grow and become more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase lotions, lingeries, perfumes, deodorant, body spray, clothes, and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Koech

texts.en:
Hello world! Meet Koech, a 37-year-old entrepreneur from Kamaget village, South Rift Kenya. Koech practices mixed farming for a living. He also engages in side businesses that fill gaps in the market, solve societal problems, and offer decent returns. The latest venture on his list is a grain mill. 

Occupants of Kamaget village travel long distances to have their grains processed into flour. Most resort to assigning this duty to children who would otherwise be spending this precious time and energy at school. Koech is planning to start a grain mill located within the village, where it is more convenient for potential customers, thus saving time and travel expenses. 

Acquiring machinery and equipment necessary to have a grain mill running is very costly, especially for a small-scale farmer like Koech. He is appealing to Kiva lenders for external financing that will make his latest venture come to life. Your investment will not only have a strong impact on his family, but also his community.

loans.use: to set up a grain mill.

loans.name: Kingote

texts.en:
Kingote is a 30-year-old, married man. He has four children ages 9, 6, 4, and 1 year respectively who he supports. 

Kingote has been keeping livestock for five years now. He is taking his first loan to purchase animal feed. He intends to use the anticipated profits to expand his current business. His hope and dream is to educate his children.

loans.use: to purchase animal feed.

loans.name: Magadaline

texts.en: Magdaline is 20 years old, female, and single. She has been growing wheat and maize for two years. She is taking her first loan to purchase farm inputs. She intends to use the anticipated profit to expand her current business. Her hopes and dreams is to have a large scale farm.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs.

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en:
Nicholas is 52 years old and married to Keremencia; they are blessed with six children aged between 14 and 29 years. He has been a dairy farmer for the last 12 years and earns a monthly income of KES 9,000. 

Nicholas has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy a dairy cow to enable him increase the number of litres of milk that he supplies to his customers. 

Nicholas plans to use the gained profits to educate his children and repay the loan. 

His hope is that he will be delivering milk to KCC in large quantities and become a large-scale farmer.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to enable him increase the number of litres of milk that he supplies to his customers

loans.name: Nhóm 5-  An Thanhv2 Group

texts.en: Phai, pictured first from the right, makes about $34 (700,000 VND) every month working in the rice paddies. She is 64 years old and has two grown children who live separately from her. She has been a member of the Women's Union since 1972. Due to economic hardship, her family has not yet been able to build a septic tank latrine and is currently using a double-pit latrine, which is now degraded. With a portion of this loan to the Nhóm 5- An Thanhv2 Group, Phai will be able to gain access to latrine hardware that include a hygienic septic tank latrine and a hand-washing device with soap. Those facilities would also help her family improve their health, living conditions, and personal safety while contributing to the environmental health of the community.

loans.use: To pay for the construction of a sanitary latrine with a device for handwashing with soap

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en:
Lawrence is married with twelve children and lives in a five room house in Bamenda, in the Northwest Region of Cameroon. He has faced a lot of problems in his life including accidents, sickness, death, and theft.
Lawrence is very optimistic that the loan to purchase a motorbike will be a success because for many years now motorbikes have been a major source of transportation in the city of Bamenda. Due to the motorbike's accessibility to remote parts of town many tend to use it for transportation, thus creating a constant availability of passengers.
With the profit made from this loan Lawrence intends to plow it into his business activity and also pay his children's school fees.
He prefers a loan from GHAPE because of the lower interest rates. Also, the interval of repayment is really encouraging and non-stressful and the non-financial services offered include loan management, training courses, time management, and social networking opportunities like baby showers and burial ceremonies.

loans.use: to pay for a motorbike and documents.

loans.name: Ana Lucia

texts.es:
Ana, tiene 24 años, es soltera tiene 2 hijos con los cuales vive en casa familiar en la comunidad de Caluqui que pertenece a González Suarez de Otavalo, la gente por la zona se dedican al comercio y también a las artesanías de las totoras ellos ofrecen dentro y fuera de la provincia todo los productos que realizan.
Ana tiene su tienda de venta de víveres esta actividad lo viene realizando desde hace 2 años atrás por el sector. Por la zona que ella vive no hay mucha competencia y ella ve muy factible seguir incrementando más el negocio a pesar de estar sola con sus dos hijos ella se esfuerza a demostrar todo lo mejor a sus hijos que empiecen a estudiar y que siempre sigan adelante, ella ha tenido días malos por motivos de la familiar de parte del padre de los hijos a pesar de eso sigue luchando en su hogar y también en su negocio a pesar de todas las cosas que le viene día a día es una persona responsable.
El crédito que solicita lo va invertir en la compra de mercadería para la tienda y así incrementar los productos que los clientes piden en la zona, agradece a la Institución por el apoyo con el capital para crecer con el negocio.
texts.en:
Ana is 24 years old. She is single, and she has 2 children. She lives with them in a family home in the community of Caluqui, which belongs to González Suarez de Otavalo. The people in this region work in commerce, and they also make crafts using reeds. They sell all of the products that they elaborate both in and out of the province.

Ana has a grocery store. She has had this business for the past two years in this sector. In the area where she lives, there is not much competition; therefore, she thinks it is very possible for her to continue expanding her business. Even though she is raising both of her children alone, she makes an effort to set a good example for her children so that they can start studying and always move forward. She has had bad days as a result of her children's father's side of the family. Nevertheless, she continues working hard at home and also at her business. Despite everything that comes her way day after day, she is a responsible person.

She is requesting a loan to buy merchandise for her grocery store. This way, she can obtain the products that customers in the region demand. She gives thanks to the institution for supporting her with a loan that will allow her to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David, 45, is a smallholder dairy farmer in Mogogosiek location, found in the South Rift area of Kenya. Milk is his family's main source of income. David always strives to ensure that his 'cash' cows are well fed, comfortable, and live in a healthy environment. 

David is seeking a loan investment of KES 75,000 to give a facelift to the animal housing on the farm. He is going to use the money to make the cowshed more conducive for his dairy cows by making it more spacious, well aerated, and give it a proper drainage system.  Improving the state of his cowshed will make the animals less prone to diseases and more productive. This will have a positive impact on his income and his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to give a facelift to his cowshed.

loans.name: Pauline's Group

texts.en:
Pauline's Group consists of 12 farmers in Webuye District and is being represented by Pauline, who is the group leader. She is 28 years old, married, and has three children. Pauline has been a farmer for five years and is referred to as a very hardworking individual.

Pauline joined One Acre Fund in 2012 and has since noticed her life has changed, especially in the fact that she has been able to consistently feed her family ever since. This year, Pauline will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but will also purchase a solar light. She is very excited about this addition since now she will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Using this loan, Pauline's Group will purchase a total of 10 solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of six acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Nhóm 11- An Thanhv2 Group

texts.en: Mai, 25, works in agricultural production with a monthly income of nearly VND 400,000. She is married with two little children. She has been a member of the Women's Union since 2009. Due to economic hardship, her family has not yet been able to build a septic tank latrine and is currently using a double-pit latrine which is now degraded. With a portion of this loan, she will be able to gain access to latrine hardware facilities which include a hygienic septic tank latrine and a hand-washing device with soap. Those facilities would also help her family improve their health, living conditions, and personal safety while contributing to the environmental health of the community. In the picture, Mai is the first from the left.

loans.use: To pay for the construction of a sanitary latrine with a device for hand washing with soap

loans.name: Kodjo

texts.fr: Kodjo est un homme marié et très entrepreneur qui est âgé de 39 ans. Kodjo vit avec sa famille dans le quartier de Soviépé. Kodjo a cinq enfants et pour subvenir aux besoins de la famille, il fabrique des savons à base de l’huile et de la soude pour gagner un revenu lui permettant d’assurer les charges. Kodjo vend ses produits dans les marchés et s’approvisionne deux fois par mois. Pour préparer de nouveaux de savons, Kodjo a besoin de ce prêt pour acheter des bidons d’huile et quelque sac de soude. Kodjo souhaite agrandir son activité et avoir un local principal de distribution
texts.en: Kodjo is a married and very enterprising man who is 39 years old. Kodjo lives with his family in the Soviépé neighborhood. Kodjo has five children and in order to support his family he makes soap from oil and lye. Earning this income permits him to take care of the expenses. Kodjo sells his products in the markets and gets his supplies two times per month. In order to prepare new soaps, Kodjo needs this loan to buy cans of oil and some bags of lye. Kodjo hopes to expand his business and to have a main distribution location.

loans.use: to buy 4 cans of oil and 1 bag of lye

loans.name: Nhóm 6- An Thanhv2 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Huyen, 49, works in agricultural production and earns a monthly income of approximately VND 700,000. She is married with two children who are still in school. She has been a member of a local Women’s Union since 1986. She is disabled herself so she cannot work hard. Now, her family is in an economic hardship situation, and they cannot afford to have a hygienic toilet. 

With this loan, she can purchase sand, cement, and bricks to build a septic tank latrine to improve the family's living conditions and contribute to the environmental protection. In this photo, Huyen is pictured first from the right.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a sanitary latrine with a device for handwashing with soap.

loans.name: Nhóm 8- An Thanhv2 Group

texts.en:
Thi, pictured first from the right, is a 35-year-old farmer, who makes about VND 400,000 monthly. She is married with three children who are still in school. She has been member of the local Women's Union since 1985. Now she has to support an old mother, and their family is in an economic hardship situation. They don't have a hygienic latrine. 

A portion of Group 8- An ThanhV2's loan will help Thi, as well as other group members, to build a hygienic toilet in their homes. This will improve her family's hygiene and health, and contribute to the sanitary improvement in her community.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a sanitary latrine with a device for handwashing with soap.

loans.name: Maziko Group

texts.en:
Modester thanks Kiva for the previous loan that they granted her. She used the loan to expand her business by buying more bales of secondhand clothes, and this helped her to successfully increase her profits. She used the profits gained to buy a plot of land.

She is requesting another loan in order to purchase materials for building a house, such as cement, iron sheets and doorframes. Modester plans to open her own shop in the near future, and hopes to send her children to private schools

loans.use: to buy cements, bricks, and iron sheets.

loans.name: Sontar Group

texts.fr: Brigitte est marié et mère de 5 enfants. Cette brave dame fait le commerce des céréales(maïs, petit mil, poids de terre, etc). Elle a besoin de ce crédit pour acheter 3 sacs de maïs à 42 000 francs; 2 sacs de petit mil à 50 000 francs , 1 sac de haricot à 28 000 francs pour revendre et le reste de l'argent servira à couvrir les autres dépenses liées à son activité. Le groupe Sontar est à son 3ème contrat de prêt avec ACFIME et fait des remboursements correcte et à bonne échéance jusque là. Après ses ventes, Brigitte aura un bénéfice qui lui permettra de s'occuper de sa famille.
texts.en:
Brigitte is married with five children. This brave lady sells cereals (maize, millet, bambara peas, etc.). She is seeking this loan to buy 3 sacks of maize for 42,000F, 2 sacks of millet for 50,000F, and one sack of beans for 28,000F for resale. Any remainder will be used to cover other business-related expenses. 

This is the Sontar group’s third loan cycle with ACFIME and so far, all repayments have been made without issues. 

Brigitte’s profits from her sales will help her to provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy 3 sacks of maize, 2 sacks of millet and one sack of beans for resale.

loans.name: Guliston

texts.ru: Гулистон 55 лет. Она уроженка района Вахш, Хатлонской области. Она замужем за преподавателя средней школы. У них в браке имеется двое детей, дочка и сын. Гулистон активная женщина. Она занимается животноводством и земледелием. У нее 0,2 га земли, где каждый год сажает сельскохозяйственные культуры. Гулистон на данный момент имеет только одного крупнорогатого скота, ей очень хочется увеличить поголовье и расширить бизнес. Для этого ей нужны средства и по этой причине она обратилась за кредитом, надеясь на Вашу помощь.
texts.en: Guliston is 55 years old. She is a native of the Vaksh area of the Hatlonsk region. She is married to high school teacher. They have two children together; a daughter and a son. Guliston is an active woman. She raises livestock and farms. She has 0.2 hectares of land where she plants crops each year. Guliston currently only has one cow, and she would very much like to expand her herd and her business. To do this she needs cash, so she is asking for a loan and hoping for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy a few livestock to expand her business

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is 36 years old, married to Keremencia and is blessed with four children ages 17, 13, 8 and 5 years. She has been a dairy farmer for the last 10 years and earns a monthly income of KES 9,000. 

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy a dairy cow to increase the number of liters of milk produced per day so as to meet her customers' demand. 

She plans to use the gained profits to educate her children and repay the loan. 

His hope is that she will be a large-scale farmer and supply milk to KCC company.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow to increase the number of liters of milk produced per day so as to meet her customers' demand.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a smallholder farmer from Besamaro location in Nyamira, Kenya. Hellen has been married for 39 years and has three children, the youngest being 27 years old. 
Hellen practices mixed-farming on a 2-acre piece of land owned by her husband. On the farm, she keeps two dairy cows, 10 poultry, and also grows tea. To make extra income, Hellen also brokers cereals and engages in the trade of second-hand clothing. 
To make the most out of her small farm, Hellen is planning to construct a greenhouse. A greenhouse will boost her crop produce yield by nearly 40% under the same area of land. This will have a significant positive impact on her business as well as her family's livelihood. The greenhouse will also cushion the family against losses from crop failure due to the nature of its controlled environment.

loans.use: to construct a greenhouse

loans.name: Donathille

texts.en:
Donathile is 47 years old, married, and has five children, four of whom attend school. She is a farmer and she has been growing rice for the past five years. Her husband is also a farmer. 

Donathile requested a loan, which she will use to buy fertilizers to grow rice. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees of her children and improve her savings.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow, to enable him get income to start a retail shop business.

loans.name: Mary's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Mary, who, as a group leader, is representing 13 farmers in Webuke District, Kenya. She is married and is a mother of four children. She is known in her community as a very hard-working individual.

Initially, Mary joined One Acre Fund in 2011 because she wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Since she joined the program, she says that her life has improved, especially because she has been able to consistently feed her family. With the profits from the coming harvesting season, Mary plans to send her children to school.

The 13 farmers in Mary's Group will plant a total of 9.5 acres of land using the maize seeds and fertilizer received from the loan. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of nine solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a motorcycle that will allow him to continue to work in the farm and to safely get around in the areas where there is no public transportation.

loans.name: Juan Angel

texts.es:
Juan, de 40 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado, está casado y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tiene cinco hijos.

Juan, es agricultor desde hace 25 años y aprendió a trabajar en el campo junto a su padre, pero además de ese trabajo, trabaja en construcción de viviendas y en el comercio de ganado y cerdos.

El crédito lo necesita para comprar cerdos para engordarlos y venderlos para obtener ganancia.

En un futuro espera poder arreglar su vivienda, considera que  con esmero, dedicación y esfuerzo lo lograra.
texts.en:
Juan is 40 years old. He studied through third grade. He is married, and his wife performs household chores. He has five children.

Juan has made a living in agriculture for the past 25 years. He learned to work in the field with his father. In addition to this job, he works in the construction of homes and the commerce of cattle and pigs. 

He is requesting a loan to buy pigs for fattening, which he will later sell to obtain an income. In the future, he hopes to be able to fix his house. He believes that with care, dedication, and effort, he will achieve this.

loans.use: to buy pigs for fattening, which he will later sell to obtain an income.

loans.name: Twisungane Group

texts.en:
TWISUNGANE is a group led by Chadia, who is 41 years old. The group name means, “Work together” in English. She is married with three children aged between 3 and 21 years. She sells foodstuffs and has been doing this business for the past seven years. The group members sell different items and they have the same ideas for changing their lives. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more bananas, potatoes, and beans to sell. The profits from the business will be used to make savings, and she plans to make a restaurant in her future.

loans.use: to buy more bananas, potatoes, and beans to sell.

loans.name: Phanice's Group

texts.en:
Phanice's Group consists of 11 farmers in Webuye District and is being represented by Phanice, who is the group leader pictured above. She is 32 years old, married, and has four children. Phanice has been a farmer for five years and is referred to as a very trustworthy person.

Phanice joined One Acre Fund in 2014 and has since noticed her life has changed, especially in the sense that she has been able to consistently feed her family ever since. This year, Phanice will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but will also purchase a solar light. She is very excited about this addition since now she will be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Using this loan, Phanice's Group will purchase a total of five solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 6.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Michael's Group

texts.en:
Michael is 62 years old and has eight children. He is a group leader, and is representing his group formed by 10 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. 

Michael has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2010. This decision was largely a result of his desire to have access to quality training, and acquire new farming methods and, although he described his last harvest as very good, he believes he could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. 

Michael also decided to purchase a solar light as part of his loan, which he is very excited about, as it will allow him to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel, and therefore save more money.

Obtaining this loan means that Michael's Group will be able to receive a total of 8 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Nhóm 1- An Thanh V2 Group

texts.en: Dao, 36, is married with two children. She works in agricultural production, with a monthly income of approximately VND 710,000. She has an eye desease that makes her work hard. She has been a member of the Women's Union since 1999. Her family is currently using a double-pit latrine, which is now degraded. With her portion of this loan, she will be able to build a hygienic septic tank latrine and a hand-washing device with soap. Those facilities would help her family improve their health and living conditions and provide safety for them. In addition to providing convenience, cleanliness, and privacy for all family members, it will be contributing to the environmental protection of the community. In the picture, Dao is pictured first from the right.

loans.use: To pay for the construction of a sanitary latrine with a device for hand washing with soap

loans.name: Shahlo

texts.ru: Шахло – женщина 30 лет, мать двоих детей, муж работает в РФ и неплохо там работает, многие годы сотрудничает с МДО Арвандом, VIP клиент в Арванде,  Шахло уже несколько лет рынке «Бадахшон»  занимается купле продажей детской и мужской одеждой. Она для расширения своего бизнеса обратилось в МДО «Арванд» для получения повторного кредита. Она рада за оказанную нами ей финансовую помощь. Её очень уважают соседи и родственники, потому, что она очень общительная и трудолюбивая. Не покладая рук она все начинала одна. Заранее благодарит МДО Арванд за финансовую помощь нуждающему населению.
texts.en: Shahlo is a 30-year-old woman and the mother of two children. Her husband is working in the Russian Federation and has good work there. For many years, she has been collaborating with MDO Arvand and is a VIP client. For several years, Shahlo has been buying and selling children's and men's clothing at the Badakhshon market. In order to expand her business, she applied to MDO Arvand for a repeat loan. She is glad for the financial help. She is very well respected by her neighbors and relatives because she is very sociable and hardworking. Tirelessly she started this all by herself. She is thankful to MDO Arvand in advance for the financial help to people in need.

loans.use: to expand the business of buying and selling of children's clothing.

loans.name: Rosemary's Group

texts.en:
Rosemary, pictured above, has six children and is always described as a very hardworking individual, which is why she was selected to become the leader of her group. Rosemary is representing her group of eight farmers in Webuye District and is happy to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

Rosemary has been a farmer for more than 20 years, and in order to earn enough to feed her family, she decided to join the One Acre Fund program this season. Her loan will not only include farming inputs, but also a solar light, which she is very happy to be getting as that means she will now have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. With the profits from this coming season, Rosemary is planning to send her children to school.

A total of 4.75 acres will be planted by Rosemary's Group, and between them they will receive a total of 5 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Nhóm 10- An Thanhv2 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thuan, pictured first from the left, is a 27-year-old farmer, who makes a monthly income of about VND 700,000. She has been a member of the local Women's Union since 2008. She has two children who are still in school, and a husband who does not have a stable job. Her family is classified as a poor family and cannot afford to have a sanitary latrine. 

With this loan, Thuan will use the funds to build a toilet, which will improve the living conditions for the family members by preventing diseases commonly associated with unhygienic toilets, and contribute to the sanitary improvement in her community.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a sanitary latrine with a device for handwashing with soap.

loans.name: Nhóm 7-  An Thanhv2 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Mai, 23, works as a farmer with a monthly income of about VND 450,000. She is married, with two little children. She has been a member of the local Women's Union since 2010. Her husband is weak and sick for the whole year. Due to the family's economic hardship, her household does not have a hygienic latrine, yet and they are currently using a double-pit latrine which is degraded. 

A portion of Group 7- An Thanhv2's loan will help Mai as well as other group members build a hygienic toilet in their home. 

This will improve the living conditions for the family members by preventing diseases commonly associated with unhygienic toilets. 

In this photo, she is pictured first from the left.

loans.use: To pay for the construction of a sanitary latrine with a device for handwashing with soap

loans.name: Adrian

texts.en: Mr. Adrian is a young 28-years-old fruit-grower, unmarried. He deals with the cultivation of apple on an area of 11 acres, of which 6 acres is own private orchard and five acres is leased from his father. Adrian, until last year, cultivated the orchard with a friend. Adrian owned aggregates for processing the orchard and his friend had a tractor, so they were a good team. This year, his friend has bought the aggregates required and decided to process the earth of his own. To cope with future work, Adrian wants to buy a tractor that costs $ 10,700. Of the total amount, $ 7,700 is his personal contribution and $ 3,000 is the amount requested. Purchasing the tractor, Adrian will be able to process and look after the apple orchard on time and this one will bring a rich and qualitative harvest, which will have a profit for business development in the future and as a result will create new jobs.

loans.use: To pay for a tractor to maintain apple orchard.

loans.name: Nhóm 9-An Thanhv2 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Men, 48, works in agricultural production and earns a monthly income of about VND 700,000. She is married with two school-age children. She has been a member of the local Women's Union since 1980. Now, her husband has liver disease, so she has to spend a lot of money on his treatment. Their family is in an economic hardship situation and they don't have a sanitary latrine yet. 

With this loan, Men will use the fund to build a septic tank toilet, which will improve the hygiene and health for the family members, and contribute to the sanitary improvement in her community. In this photo, Men is pictured first from the left.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a sanitary latrine with a device for handwashing with soap.

loans.name: Tikasoa

texts.fr:
Avant 2007, Tikasoa vendait des légumes. Puisqu'elle subissait des pertes de temps en temps à cause de la périssabilités de ce type de marchandise (difficiles à stocker), elle a décidé d'en changer en chaussettes ,collants, des parapluies et des accessoires pour cheveux comme nous le voyons sur la photo.
Elle demande un prêt afin d'acheter des marchandises supplémentaires pour éviter le va et viens journalier car en ce moment, elle n'a pas suffisamment de  stock de marchandises. Elle arrive à faire des approvisionnements plusieurs fois par jour car le fonds de roulement est insuffisant. Elle ne peut le faire qu'après avoir vendus certains marchandises.
34 ans, c'est une femme courageuse, elle est mariée et a 5 enfants dont 2 déjà mariés et 3 encore à sa charge. Son objectif est de pouvoir continuer à assurer la scolarisation de ses enfants pour qu'ils puissent avoir de bonnes carrières plus tard.
texts.en:
Before 2007, Tikasoa sold vegetables. Because she suffered losses from time to time due to the perishable nature of this type of merchandise (difficult to store), she decided to change to socks, tights, some umbrellas, and some hair accessories as we see in the photo. 

She asks for this loan in order to buy supplementary merchandise to avoid the coming and going every day, because, right now, she does not have a sufficient stock of merchandise. She manages to get these supplies several times per day because the working capital is insufficient. She can only do this after having sold some merchandise. 

34 years old, she’s a courageous woman. She is married and has 5 children, of which 2 are already married and 3 are still under her charge. Her goal is to be able to continue to assure the schooling of her children so that they can have good careers later.

loans.use: to buy some socks, some tights, umbrellas, and hair accessories (barrettes, hair clips)

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
This is Amelita, a resident of Dasmarinas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married, and manages the household while operating the business. She works hard to augment their income to meet their daily personal and household needs.

Amelita operates a computer rental shop. In the Philippines, very few people have their own computers. People go to an Internet Café either for their business, school requirements, or business documents. She rents out computers by the hour, and offers printing and typing services. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 1,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in rentals every day.

To help her improve her business, she is requesting a Php 8,000 loan to pay for reformatting and parts for her personal computers for an efficient service at her computer shop. 

Aside from her internet shop, she also has a small general store and is a dealer of popular brands of personal products. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help and a good turnout of her business because it really helps meet their everyday needs.

Amelita aims to grow all her businesses and have a comfortable life in her old age. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and were she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for parts and reformatting of her personal computers at her internet shop.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita, age 53, is married to a farmer and they're blessed with three children. She has owned and managed a banana plantation at their backyard for almost two years, and earns a net income of PHP 1,200 weekly. She sells banana around their village. Her net profits on her business are usually spent on their daily expenses and the school allowances of her three grandchildren. 

Due to insufficient capital to use in her business, she would like to avail a loan amounting to PHP 9,000 to purchase fertilizers and banana seedlings to use on her banana plantation. She's hoping that her business will continue to grow and become more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and banana seedlings to use on her banana plantation.

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.en:
A goal oriented and hardworking woman, Mavluda always achieves her goals passing hard periods of her life and making a better standard of living. She was born in 1958. She and her family are living in a remote district. She has been an experienced and challenged businesswoman for about 20 years. She is a widow and has only one son. 

She has a business of keeping livestock and planting agricultural products. Mavluda tries to feed her family. Every year her son goes to the Russian Federation to find a good job for earning money. He considers that the Russian Federation has more possibilities than Tajikistan. Unfortunately, this year he could not go to the Russian Federation, because he had problems with preparation of documents. Mavluda decided to work together with her son. She likes her business, and it is pleasure for her to share it with her son. She will spend gained income for family and house expenditures. She is asking a loan from Kiva project to buy horned cattle for her business. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy horned cattle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Rose's Group

texts.en:
Rose, pictured above, has been a farmer for 20 years, and is now proud to represent her group of 11 farmers in Webuye District. She is 44 years old, is married, and has nine children.

Rose likes to think of herself as a very trustworthy person. She has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2014, and decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers. She says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that she has been able to consistently feed her family. Rose plans to use the profits from this coming season to buy a cow.

In total, Rose’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 5.25 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light with this loan, the group will also receive a total of four solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Metrine's Group

texts.en:
Metrine is 34 years old and is often described as a very trustworthy person. She has four children and is married. As a group leader, Metrine is representing her group of eight farmers in Webuye District in Kenya, and is very excited to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

The decision to join One Acre Fund was largely a result of Metrine's desire to earn enough to send her children to school. Apart from receiving farming inputs, she is also purchasing a solar light as part of her loan, which is very exciting to her, as she will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits that she gains from this year’s harvest, she plans to buy a cow.

Metrine and her group will receive a total of seven solar lights as well as input loans of maize and fertilizer to plant a total of 4.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Hafizamoh

texts.ru: Хафизамох трудолюбивая и ответственная женщина в возрасте 56 лет. Она замужем и имеет четырех детей. Хафизамох живёт в маленьком посёлке. Она очень любит своих детей и старается дать им всё необходимое для того, чтобы они могли расти, развиваться и реализовывать себя в обществе. Для этого Хафизамох занимается своим бизнесом, чтобы иметь постоянный доход. Она закупает и продаёт детскую одежду. Закупает она свой товар на большом оптовом рынке и продаёт на местном рынке своего посёлка. Для этого у неё имеется собственная лавка. Сейчас Хафизамох желает расширить ассортимент своего товара, ей необходимо закупить побольше весенней  одежды, так как начинается весенний сезон. Поэтому она обратилась в Арванд и желает получить кредит на покупку одежды. Хафизамох очень надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Hafizamoh is a hardworking and responsible woman of 56. She is married and has four children. Hafizamoh lives in a small village. She very much loves her children and strives to give them everything needed for them to grow, develop, and realize themselves in society. For this, Hafizamoh is engaged in her own business in order to have a regular income. She buys and sells children's clothing. She buys her goods wholesale and sells them in a local market in her community. For this purpose, she has her own shop. Now Hafizamoh wishes to expand the assortment of her goods and it's necessary for her to purchase more spring clothing since the spring season is beginning.

Therefore, she applied to Arvand and wishes to get a loan to buy clothing. Hafizamoh very much hopes for a positive result and gives her thanks in advance to Arvand for the support.

loans.use: to buy goods for sale.

loans.name: Dilfuza

texts.ru:
Дилфуза трудолюбивая женщина в возрасте 35 лет. Она замужняя женщина  и имеет  троих детей. Она работает в медицинском пункте кишлака уборщицей. Муж занимается животноводством и земледелием. Дилфуза в свободное время тоже помогает,  мужу ухаживать за скотом. 
 Но сейчас Дилфуза  хочет расширить бизнес, именно по выращиванию сельхозкультуры. Но сейчас у неё недостаточно собственных денежных средств, чтобы закупить семена для посева урожая. Поэтому она обратилась в Арванд и хочет взять кредит для закупа семян для посева. Дилфуза  очень надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Dilfuza is a hardworking woman, aged 35. She is married and has three children. She works in a medical clinic as a cleander. Her husband is engaged in raising livestock and crops. In her free time, Dilfuza also helps her husband to tend the livestock.

But now Dilfuza wants to expand her business, that is in the cultivation of crops. But now she has insufficient funds of her own in order to purchase seeds for sowing. Therefore, she applied to Arvand and wants to take a loan to buy seeds for sowing. Dilfuza very much hopes for a positive result and thanks Arvand in advance for the support.

loans.use: to buy seeds

loans.name: Marita's Group

texts.en:
Marita is a 45-year-old proud mother of eleven children. She is a group leader, is often described as a very friendly person, and is representing her group of twelve farmers from Webuye District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Marita has noticed that she has had more profits from each harvest.

Marita described her harvest as excellent last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, in addition to fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Marita’s Group will be able to plant a total of 5.5 acres of land and purchase a total of ten solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation and a solar light

loans.name: Sokkoeurn

texts.en:
Sokkoeurn is a villager from Preah Vihear province. She is a mother of four school-children. To struggle for a living, she grows rice as the main source of income. 

This is not the first loan for Sokkoeurn with VisionFund (Kiva's partner). She has repaid back her past loan wisely. Now, she requests a new loan of 600,000 KHR in order to pay for plowing fees. She hopes that she can support her business timely.

loans.use: to pay for plowing fees.

loans.name: Sohorn

texts.en:
A Prey Chhor district villager of Kampong Cham province, Sophorn is a 25-year-old married woman with two kids who are her dependents. To support the family, Sophorn and her husband have been farming rice for seven years, and her husband has been a construction worker during his free time. 

Being a member with VisionFund (Kiva's partner) twice, Sophorn is seeking a new loan to buy a motorcycle in order to commute to work. She expects that the motorcycle will facilitate her business when she needs to go to buy supplies and sell her harvest; in return, that makes it more profitable.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Ruzigul

texts.ru: Рузигул умная, заботливая женщина в возрасте 32 лет. У нее двое прекрасных детей и любящий муж. Она занимается колхозным хозяйством вот уже семь лет. Ее муж также вносит свой вклад в семейный бюджет, но у них намечается мероприятия. Для проведения мероприятия им необходимо денежные средства. С согласия мужа она хочет получить кредит в Арванде для проведения мероприятия. Она заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку!!!
texts.en: Ruzigul is a clever, loving woman of 32. She has two lovely children and a loving husband. She has been working on a collective farm for seven years. Her husband also contributes to the family budget but they are planning a celebration. To put on the party, they need money. With the agreement of her husband, she wants to take a loan from Arvand to conduct the celebration. She gives thanks in advance to Arvand for the support!!!

loans.use: to cover expenses for a party

loans.name: Voahangilalao

texts.fr:
39 ans, divorcée, Voahangilalao et ses 3 filles vivent ensemble dans leur maison à location. C'est une femme très courageuse ayant de l'ambition. Elle n'a jamais eu à se plaindre même si elle a eu à élever toute seule ses enfants depuis que son mari l'a quitté.
Elle vends des ustensiles et accessoires de cuisines en plastiques et en inox, il y .a déjà 15 ans. Maintenant ses 2 filles, l'ainée et le la cadette l'aident dans l'exercice de cette activité tandis que la dernière va encore à l'école.
Le crédit va lui permettre de mieux ravitailler et diversifier davantage les marchandises afin d'attirer beaucoup de clients. 
C'est avec le revenu de cette activité qu'elle a pu et continue à soutenir sa petite famille:scolariser, nourrir, et vêtir ses enfants.
Elle rêve des brillants avenirs pour ses filles et qu'elles n'auront pas à subir les même sorts qu'elle
texts.en:
Voahangilalao, aged 39, is a divorced woman, who lives together with her three daughters in a house they rent. She is a very courageous woman with ambitions. She has never had to complain, even if she had to raise her children  by herself after her husband left her. For fifteen years, she has been selling plastic and stainless steel kitchen utensils and accessories. Today, her two daughters, the eldest and the youngest, help her in operating her business, while the remaining daughter is still in school. 

This loan is going to enable Voahangilalao to do better at resupplying herself and to diversity her merchandise more, so as to attract a lot of customer. With the revenues from this business, she has been able to continue supporting her small family: schooling, food, and clothing for her children. She dreams of a bright future for her daughters, such that they won’t have to experience the same fate as she.

loans.use: to purchase brooms, clothes pins, laundry baskets, trash cans, and accessories

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to add tableware such as plates, spoons and forks.

loans.name: Ayatullah

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of the new Ruma agents, Ayat. Ayat lives in Cilegon, located about two hours from Jakarta, the capital city. He lives there with his wife and his two children. His wife is a full time housewife and mother. Ayat owns a small stall where he sells daily consumer products and provides mobile payment services to his community. Ayat knows Ruma from the sales executive who came to his stall. He wants to join Ruma because he wants to learn how to improve his business using technology.

As the business starts to run, Ayat is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile payment services to his community. Having known about its importance, your loan will be very useful to help Ayat improve his business and accordingly his community, which needs access to such services. As seen in the photo, Ayat is the one who is standing in front of his small stall. He will be thankful for your support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile payment services to his community

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a solar home system

loans.name: Cesiri N°2 Group

texts.fr: La dame arrêtée au bout avec le bélier en main est Alima sur la photo. Alima est une éleveuse Malienne âgée de 44 ans, mariée, mère de 05 enfants dont 03 sont à l’école,  âgés de 07 à 15 ans. Son mari est un cultivateur qui achète les céréales pendant la saison sèche ils sont tous analphabète .Elle demande le prêt au RMCR pour acheter beaucoup de moutons. Elle veut avoir  les troupeaux dans les jours à venir. Le bénéfice qu’elle réalise de son embouche lui permet de préparé l’avenir de ses enfants. Alima s’approvisionne dans les marchés locaux de son village natal et revend dans le même marché.
texts.en:
The lady standing at the end and holding a ram in the photo is Alima. She is a Malian livestock farmer, 44 years old, and a married mother of five children (three in school), aged 7 to 15 years old. Her husband is a farmer who buys grains during the dry season. They are all illiterate. 

Alima is asking for a loan at RMCR to purchase many sheep. She wants to have a flock in the days to come. The profits she makes from fattening them will enable her to prepare for her children’s future. Alima gets her supplies at the local markets in the village of her birth, and she resells at the same market.

loans.use: to purchase animals to raise and then resell

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
This nice and pretty lady is Anna and she is 22 years old. This will be her second Kiva loan and, as before, it will help her develop her clothes-selling  business. Anna is already married and she lives in Kapan city of Syunik region with her beloved husband. She now studies at the Architectural University of Kapan city’s branch, in the distance learning division. 

Anna still manages to have her small clothes-selling business at the city wholesale market, in a rented stall. She sells women's and men's clothes, as well as bags and shoes for women. She has worked in this field for three years and during this short period of time she has managed to gain regular customers thanks to her polite and nice service and the good prices of clothes in her stall. Anna’s husband works at the combine of their city as a welder. 

Anna asks for this loan because she wants to buy a new collection of clothes for the spring season, as it is already in great demand; she wants to buy nice clothes: colorful, fashionable and not very expensive.

loans.use: to buy a new collection of clothes for the spring season to meet customers' demands

loans.name: Urumuli Group
