Policarpo es un padre de familia trabajador, el para generar sus ingresos y mantener a su familia se dedica a dos actividades  la primera actividad es el cultivo de maíz y frijol en un lugar cercano de su comunidad, y la segunda actividad es que él trabaja como jornalero con sus vecinos, Para el su avanzada edad no es un problema, es por eso que él quiere seguir sembrar su milpa en esta época, pero Policarpo tiene un problema es que no cuenta con dinero suficiente para pagar el alquiler del terreno donde el siembra y comprar sus semillas como también sus fertilizantes, entonces Policarpo ha buscado una solución y es la de solicitar un prestamo para poder sembrar.
El gran deseo de Policarpo es poder ahorrar para no sufrir en un futuro cuando ya no pueda trabajar.
texts.en:
Policarpo lives in a community of Sololá. He is 70 years old. He is married and has a beautiful family of five children between the ages of 20 and 34.

Policarpo is a hard-working father of a family. To generate his income and maintain his family, he works in two activities. The first is growing corn and beans in a place near his community, and the second is that he works as a day laborer for his neighbors. For him, his advanced age is not a problem. It is for this reason that he wants to continue planting his cornfield at this time. But Policarpo has a problem -- he doesn't have enough money to pay to rent the land where he plants and to buy his seeds and his fertilizers. So Policarpo has looked for a solution, and it is to apply for a loan to be able to plant.

Policarpo's great desire is to be able to save so that he doesn't suffer in the future when he is not able to work.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers and pay to rent land.

loans.name: Witethie Self Help Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Lilian, a member of Witeithie Self Help Group in Nakuru, Kenya. She is forty-five years old, married and blessed with three children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiHEA) in July 2013.

Lilian does maize, beans and banana farming on her small farm. She is grateful for HiHEA enterprise management training that has enabled her to manage the enterprise well. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to purchase farm inputs such as pesticides and manure that will help increase crop yields, thus giving a better income to enable her to support basic family needs such as education, medical care and clothing.

Lilian is happy with Kiva and its lenders for their intervention and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as pesticides and manure to improve crop yield.

loans.name: Jacqueline Fleur D'olive

texts.fr:
Jacqueline, une jeune femme dynamique, débrouillarde, courageuse, a 34 ans. C'est une mère de famille de 2 enfants scolarisés.
Elle et son mari exerce ensemble leur activité génératrice de revenu: vente des vêtements prêt à porter, et ceci depuis plus de 10 ans.
Elle sollicite un crédit pour acheter plus de marchandises comme pantalon et tee-shirt pour homme ainsi que slim et short pour  femme, très tendance actuellement.
Elle rêve d'ouvrir d'ici peu un deuxième point de vente car comme ça, elle et son mari peuvent tenir chacun un lieu de vente et par conséquent, le revenu va automatiquement augmenter et la condition de vie familiale s'améliorer.
En plus, elle veut avoir sa propre maison et n'aura plus à payer des loyers
texts.en:
Jacqueline, a dynamic, resourceful, courageous, young woman, is 34 years old. She is a mother of a family of 2 schooled children. 

She and her husband together practice their income generating activity: selling ready-to-wear clothing, and have done so for more than 10 years. She requests this loan to buy more merchandise such as pants and t-shirts for men, as well as underwear and shorts for women, very trendy currently. 

She dreams of opening a second point of sale soon because, in this way, she and her husband can each manage a place of sale. As a result, their income will automatically increase and the condition of the family life will improve. Furthermore, she wants to have her own house and to no longer have to pay rent.

loans.use: to buy some pants and t-shirts for men, and underwear and shorts for women.

loans.name: Xazri

texts.en:
Xazri is 28 years old, married and has a daughter, who is going to kindergarten. Xazri is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from Fuzuli city. Currently, he lives with his lovely family in the Fuzuli region.

Xazri has been in the animal breeding business for 9 years. He learned this profession from his father and his wife helps him in this business. They make various different dairy products from milk and sells them for money. They also deal in the sale of meat.

Today, in order to increase the family business, Xazri needs a loan of 1100 AZN (Azerbaijani New Manat). With this loan he wants to vaccinate his animals. He says a grateful thank you to the Kiva organization and lenders for the help.

loans.use: to vaccinate his animals and increase business.

loans.name: Cristy

texts.en:
Cristy used her prior loan to buy materials and supplies needed to continue her rug-making business. The loan also helped her provide for her family's daily needs and expenditures.

Cristy is requesting another loan for 10,000 PHP, which she will use to buy additional supplies of gallons for mineral water and additional raw supplies and materials to make more doormats and rugs so she can increase her profits. An increase in profits will also enable her business to become viable and sustainable while meeting the needs of her family.

Cristy wants to give her family a better life. She knows that all her hard work in business will pay off. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, cloth, thread, needles, and other materials needed in her rug-making business and to purchase gallons for her water distribution business

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen is from Stepanavan town, where he lives with his wife and two children (6 and 5 years old). 

Armen is a construction worker. His wife takes care of the household and children, so Armen is the only worker in the family. 

Five years ago, while starting to provide construction work, Armen could only afford to purchase low-cost materials. Now, after making his work sustainable and getting a stable income, Armen decided to apply for this loan. He asks lenders to support him in purchasing tools needed for his work. 

His loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides business start-up loans to informal businesses that do not qualify through normal channels.

loans.use: to pay for tools needed for construction work

loans.name: Bridget's Group

texts.en:
Bridget is 48 years old and has ten children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by fourteen farmers in Webuye District, Kenya.

Bridget has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely a result of her desire to earn enough to feed her family and, although she described her last harvest as good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund.

Bridget also decided to purchase two solar lights as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Obtaining this loan means that Bridget's Group will be able to receive a total of twelve solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 9.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Bashkim

texts.en:
Bashkim wants to buy a dairy cow and is planning to expand his livestock from here on.

Bashkim is a married father of four boys ranging in age from 13 to 23, with all of them going to school. The only source of income for his family has been the animal husbandry activity that he has been practicing for so many years now.

He has three cows at the moment from which he sells three calves every year at a total price of $1,500 and also homemade cottage cheese and butter at a price of $30/month. He sells corn and beans as well, and from this he makes about $1,000/year. His clientele for the dairy products is a little kiosk where they make/sell pies.

loans.use: to buy another dairy cow in order to expand his livestock.

loans.name: Catherine's Group

texts.en:
Catherine is a 42-year-old proud mother of 5 children. She is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing her group of 11 farmers in Webuye District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Catherine has noticed that she has had more profits from each harvest.

Catherine described her harvest as excellent last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. 

She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Catherine’s Group will be able to plant a total of 5.75 acres of land and purchase a total of 9 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Iris Noemi

texts.es:
Iris, vende productos de revista y ropa para damas, caballeros, niños y niñas, vive con su mamá y sus tres hijos, ella se dedica trabajar de ocho de la mañana a tres de la tarde cada día para generar recursos económicos y cubrir las necesidades familiares, lo atiende sola desde que tenía una edad de 18 años.
Utilizará el capital para comprar labiales, rubores, lociones, cremas corporales, mascarillas, entre otros productos para diversificar su negocio, le servirá para atraer nuevos clientes y mejorar sus ventas.
Su proyección es tener un mini bazar en su vivienda para tener mejores ingresos y dar a su familia un estilo de vida digno.
texts.en:
Iris sells products from a magazine as well as clothing for women, men and children. She lives with her mother and her three children. She works from 8:00am until 3:00pm every day to generate a financial income and cover the family's needs. She has done this alone since she was 18 years old.

She will use this loan to buy lipstick, blush, lotion, body cream, face masks, and other products to diversify her business. This will help her to attract new clients and improve her sales.

Her goal is to have a minimarket in her home to earn a better income and give her family a decent lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy lipstick, blush, lotion, body cream, face masks, and other products to diversify her business.

loans.name: Naima

texts.ru: Наима умная женщина в возрасте 41 лет. У нее трое прекрасных детей и хороший муж. Они живут в деревне и занимаются животноводством. Они имеют опыт   в этом дело и занимаются вот уже несколько  лет. С его доходом обеспечивают свою семью. Но сейчас дочь её серьезно больна и ей необходимо срочно сделать операцию. Для операции у них недостаточно финансовых средств. С согласием мужа Наима хочет получить кредит в Арванде  для проведения операции своей дочери  и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку и понимание!!!
texts.en: Naima is a smart 41-year-old woman. She has three beautiful children and a good husband. They live in a village and are involved in animal husbandry. They have experience in this business and have been involved in it for several years. The income from the business supports the whole family. However, Naima's daughter is currently ill and needs to urgently have a surgery. The family does not have enough money for the surgery. With her husband's agreement, Naima wants to obtain a loan from Arvand to pay for her daughter's surgery and thanks Arvand for the support and understanding in advance!!!

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's surgery

loans.name: Miguel Antonio

texts.es:
Miguel, de 51 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos y a vender frutas y verduras, tienen cinco hijos, de los cuales solo dos dependen económicamente de él.

Miguel, es empleado de seguridad para un institución de salud desde hace varios años, pero también realiza trabajos de agricultura, ya que le gusta sembrar maíz y frijol para el consumo familiar.

El préstamo lo utilizara para hacerle reparaciones al techo y paredes de su vivienda, porque se acerca la época lluviosa y teme que les suceda algún accidente por la fragilidad del suelo y los vientos fuertes.

Miguel, en un futuro desea comprar un carro y además desea ver a sus hijos, convertirse en profesionales útiles para la sociedad.
texts.en:
Miguel, 51, studied up until the third grade. He is in a relationship and his partner is dedicated to the household duties and selling fruit and vegetables. They have five children, of whom only two depend on him financially.

Miguel has been a security employee at a health institution for several years. He also works in agriculture, since he likes growing corn and beans for the family's consumption.

He will use this loan to make repairs to the roof and walls of his home, because the rainy season is coming and he fears that an accident will happen due to the fragile floor and strong winds.

In the future, Miguel wishes to buy a cart. He would also like to see his children become professionals who are useful to society.

loans.use: to repair the roof and walls of his home, as the rainy season is coming and he fears that an accident will happen.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es: Teresa de 50 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hijo, ella se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol y también  posee una tortillería, se dedica a la siembra desde hace 10 años su hijo le ayuda en el trabajo, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de todos los insumos agrícolas necesarios si como el pago de alquiler de la parcela ya que ella no posee terreno propio para cultivar y asi poder seguir con su trabajo que es el único medio para obtener ingresos.
texts.en:
Teresa, 50, lives in her own house with her son. She grows corn and beans, and she also owns a tortilla shop. She has been growing crops for ten years. Her son helps her with her work. With what she earns from her sales, she manages to cover some of her household expenses.

She is applying for a loan to buy all of the farm supplies she needs, as well as to pay rent on a plot of land since she does not own her own land on which she can grow crops. She will then be able to continue with her work, which is her only source of income.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies and rent a plot of land.

loans.name: Irving Omar

texts.es:
Irving, de 23 años de edad, estudio hasta quinto grado, está casado y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tiene un hijo de dos años de edad.

Irving, tiene cuatro años de estar prestando servicio militar, en la tercera brigada de infantería, funciones y actividades que realiza dos semanas completas en campos y no tiene horario fijo; anteriormente, trabajaba con su mamá en un negocio familiar de venta de alimentos.

El préstamo lo utilizara para comprarle una máquina de coser a su padre, porque es sastre y necesita una nueva máquina para seguir trabajando.

En un futuro desea comprar una bomba, para extraer agua de un pozo y facilitar la obtención de ese vital líquido.
texts.en:
Irving, 23, studied up until the fifth grade. He is married and his wife is dedicated to the household duties. He has a two-year-old child.

Irving has been in the military service for four years. He is in the third brigade of the infantry. He carries out activities in the field for two full weeks and does not have a fixed schedule. Earlier, he worked with his mother in the family business selling food.

He will use this loan to buy a sewing machine for his father, because he is a tailor. He needs a new machine to keep working.

In the future, he would like to buy a pump to extract water from a well and facilitate the process of obtaining this vital liquid.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for his father because he is a tailor.

loans.name: Rufina

texts.es: Rufina de 50 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hijo, ella se dedica al cultivo de sandia y granos básicos  desde hace 20 años su hijo le ayuda en el trabajo, cuando su cosecha de granos básicos ya esta lista la almacena en loa graneros que muestra la fotografía, luego la comercializa en los alrededores de la zona donde ella reside, Rufina está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, pesticidas, controles de plagas, etc. y asi poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rufina, 50, lives in her own house with her son. She has been growing watermelons and basic grains for twenty years. Her son helps her with her work. When her harvest of basic grains is prepared in the storehouse of the granaries shown in the photograph, she sells them near the area where she lives.

Rufina is applying for a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, pesticide, pest control, etc. in order to have a better income for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, pesticide, pest control, etc.

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es: Manuel de 56 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos hijas y sus tres nietos, el se dedica al cultivo de maíz, frijol y maicillo, además a la crianza de ganado lechero, posee más de 30 años de dedicarse a la agricultura y le ayuda una de sus hijas, la época en que cultiva es de enero a abril y cuando esta lista su cosecha la almacena en sacos como muestra la fotografía para luego comercializarlos, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. y asi poder tener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Manuel, 56, lives in his own house with his two daughters and three grandchildren. He makes a living by growing corn, beans, and millet. He also raises dairy cattle. He has worked in agriculture for over thirty years, and one of his daughters helps him. He grows crops from January to April, and when his harvest is ready, he stores it in sacks such as those shown in the photograph so that he can later sell them.

He is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer, manure, pest control, weed killers, etc. in order to have a better financial income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, manure, pest control, weed killers, etc.

loans.name: Dominique Jola

texts.fr:
34 ans, heureux d'être marié, Dominique avec l'aide de sa femme vend des légumes depuis 2009.
C'est un homme passionné par son activité, il cherche toujours à améliorer. Au tout début, s'il ne faisait que des ventes en détail sur son lieu de vente, maintenant, il fait des ventes en gros et livrent chez un grand hôtel de la ville et projette d'en effectuer dans les différentes grandes surfaces et des restaurants.
C'est la raison de la demande de crédit, qui va lui permettre d'augmenter les stocks de marchandises afin d’honorer les commandes de ces nouveaux clients.
Il doit travailler dure donc pour faire face aux dépenses familiales: nourritures, frais de scolarité, vêtements
Il veut aussi épargner plus pour le futur  et l'avenir de la famille et surtout de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Dominique is 34 years old and happily married. With the help of his wife, he has been selling vegetables since 2009. He enjoys his work and always looks for ways to improve it. At first, he  used to sell only retail from his stand; at present he also sells wholesale and delivers to a major hotel in town. He also plans to deliver to various supermarkets and restaurants. 

This is why he is requesting a loan, which will allow him to increase his stock level in order to fulfill the orders of his new customers. He needs to work hard in order to keep up with family expenses: food, school fees, clothing etc. He would also like to start saving more in order to provide for his family’s future, especially for his children.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, carrots, beets, various green leafy vegetables etc.

loans.name: Mayram

texts.ru:
Майрам доброжелательная женщина, ей 60 лет. Она вдова, ее муж умер давно. У нее трое хороших детей. Она медсестра. У нее неплохой заработок но все же на необходимые условия недостаточны чтобы осуществить все свои мечты. 
Она хочет отремонтировать свой дом чтобы улучшить условия для проживания, но  собственных средств у нее недостаточно. Для получение кредита она обратилась в нашу организацию и хочет  получить кредит в Арванде. Она заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку и доверие!!!
texts.en: Mayram is a kind 60-year-old woman. She is a widow; her husband passed away a long time ago. She has three good children. She is a nurse and has a good salary, but still not enough to create better conditions and achieve her dreams. She wants to repair her house in order to improve her living conditions, but does not have enough of her own money to do so. She came to the Arvand organization to obtain a loan. She thanks Arvand for the support and trust in advance!!!

loans.use: to buy building materials in order to repair her house

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 39-year-old mother from the Siaya region, which is located in the western part of Kenya. She is a widow and supports 4 people in her family. Her four children are 17, 14, 11 and 8 years old. 

She has a tailoring stall which has been operating for the last 12 years generating a monthly income of 12000 KES. 

Elizabeth is taking her first loan with Visionfund Kenya. She will use it to purchase solar panels to light up her home. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her current business.

Her dream is expand her business and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase solar panels.

loans.name: Rosa Candida

texts.es:
Rosa, se dispone a cultivar maíz nuevamente y necesita de más capital para comprar concentrado para cerdos, semilla, abono, herbicidas e insecticidas, para fortalecer su negocio.
Al utilizar el financiamiento anterior para continuar practicando la agricultura ha tenido como resultado estabilidad en su economía familiar y ha cancelado algunas deudas.
texts.en:
Rosa is getting reading to grow corn again and needs more capital to buy pig feed, seeds, fertilizer, herbicides, and insecticides to strengthen her business.

By using the previous loan to continue working in agriculture, she has achieved greater economic stability for her family and has paid back some debts.

loans.use: to buy pig feed, seeds, fertilizer, herbicides, and insecticides to strengthen her business

loans.name: Ana Dilia

texts.es:
Ana, de 48 años de edad, estudio hasta primer grado, está acompañada y su pareja es agricultor en pequeño, tienen 4 hijos, todos sus hijos tiene sus propias familias. 

Ana, tiene venta de tortillas desde hace 5 años, aprendió ya que le ayudaba a una vecina; los fines de semana vende enchiladas y tamales, ella sale a venderlos en la comunidad y el horario de trabajo es todos los días, desde las 8:00 a.m. a 4:00 p.m. 

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar varios quintales de maíz y comprar leña para cocer los alimentos que vende, anteriormente se le otorgó un crédito y le ayudo mucho para continuar con su negocio. 

El sueño de Ana, es seguir trabajando en su negocio y en un futuro tener un local fijo y grande para vender sus productos.
texts.en:
48-year-old Ana went to school through first grade. She has a common-law partner who is a small scale farmer. They have 4 children, who all have their own families.

For the past 5 years, Ana has sold tortillas, which she learned to do with the help of a neighbor. On the weekends, she sells enchiladas and tamales. She goes out to sell them in the community, and her work schedule is 8am to 4pm every day.

She needs this loan to buy several quintals [1 quintal ~ 100 lb.] of corn and to buy firewood to cook the food she sells. She was previously given a loan that was a great help to her to continue her business.

Ana's dream is to carry on working in her business and, in the future, to have a large, established location from which she can sell her products.

loans.use: to buy several quintals of corn and to buy firewood to cook the food she sells

loans.name: Maritess

texts.en:
Maritess is a 33-year-old married woman and a mother of a six-year-old child from Leyte, Philippines. 

Maritess runs a small sari-sari or retail store business selling various goods and items to the people in her place. Maritess has been in the business for more than three years now. 

Maritess is asking to take a loan to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, candies, bread and biscuits, cooking oil and condiments. A loan will help her improve her stock, thus attracting more buyers in her store.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, candies, bread and biscuits, cooking oil and condiments

loans.name: Juana Isabel

texts.es:
Juana, con el apoyo del préstamo anterior surtió su negocio con la mercadería necesaria para seguir generando ingresos y cuidar mejor a su familia, hasta la fecha no ha tenido dificultades para mantenerse trabajando.
Está necesitando de un nuevo crédito para comprar boquitas, jugos, dulces, arroz, frijoles, galletas, aceite, etc., para surtir el chalet y elaborar meriendas que vende en la escuela.
texts.en:
With the help of her previous loan, Juana stocked her business with the necessary merchandise to continue generating an income and caring for her family even better. Up till now, she has not had any trouble continuing to work.

She currently needs another loan to buy packaged snacks, juice, sweets, rice, beans, cookies, oil, etc. to stock the shop and make snacks that she sells at the school.

loans.use: to buy packaged snacks, juice, sweets, rice, beans, cookies, oil, etc. to stock the shop and make snacks that she sells at the school

loans.name: Annaliza

texts.en:
Annaliza is a 43-year-old married woman and a mother of four children from Leyte, Philippines. 

She runs a small sari-sari or retail store business selling various goods and items to the people in her place. 

Annaliza is asking to take a loan to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, rice, bread and biscuits, cooking oil and condiments. This loan will help her improve her stock thus attracting more buyers in her store. 

In the future, Annaliza hopes of making her business more sustainable and productive.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, rice, bread and biscuits, cooking oil and condiments

loans.name: Eunice's Group

texts.en:
Eunice's Group is formed by 15 farmers in Webuye District and is being represented by Eunice, who is the group leader pictured above. She is 31 years old, is married, and has 4 children. Eunice has been a farmer for 7 years and is often referred to as a very hardworking individual.

Eunice isn’t new to One Acre Fund; she actually joined the program in 2014 and has since noticed her life has changed, especially in the sense that she has been able to consistently feed her family ever since. This year, Eunice will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but she will also purchase a solar light. She is very excited about this addition since now she will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Using this loan, Eunice's Group will purchase a total of 5 solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 7.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Tinyade Group

texts.en:
Chimwemwe is 31 years old and sells fish in the nearest market. She started this business in order to support her family by providing them with needed resources. 

Chimwemwe has six children. Four of her children go to school, while the other two help her run her business. 

She will use the loan to expand her business by purchasing more inventory. She plans to build a better house for her children. The profits from the previous loans have helped her to be able to pay school fees for her children and to provide them with basic needs such as shelter.

loans.use: to buy fish

loans.name: Phones's Group

texts.en:
Phones is a 42-year-old proud mother of 8 children. She is a group leader, often described as a very friendly person, and is representing her group of 10 farmers in Webuye District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Phones has noticed that she has been able to consistently feed her family.

Phones described her harvest as excellent last year, but she believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to buy a goat.

With this loan, Phones’s Group will be able to plant a total of 7.75 acres of land and purchase a total of 2 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Fridah's Group

texts.en:
Fridah is a 56-year-old proud mother of 6 children. She is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing her group of 10 farmers in Webuye District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Fridah has noticed that she has been able to consistently feed her family.

Fridah described her harvest as good last year, but she believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Fridah’s Group will be able to plant a total of 6 acres of land and purchase a total of 9 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Rosa Estela

texts.es: Rosa de 35 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida, ella se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos desde hace 4 años, gracias a su trabajo es como logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Rosa comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que están cerca de su casa, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de abono para sus cultivos y así poder recoger mejores cosechas para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rosa is 35 years old and lives with her husband in a home that the couple owns. Rosa has grown staple grain crops for the past four years, earning enough to meet her household expenses. She sells her crops at various markets near her home. 

Rosa is applying for a loan for the purchase of fertilizer for her crops in order to boost her harvest and achieve a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her crops.

loans.name: Ermira

texts.en:
Ermira and her husband, Bledar are in their early 30's and parents of two; 3 and 5 years old. For the past 15 years, Bledar has been operating a cellphone store and service that recently got burglarized. 

The loan she is requesting from you will be used to pay off the clients whose phones were stolen during the burglary, and also to buy other new ones to sell. 

Ermira works somewhere else to earn an income. “In these 15 years of having the store, never was stolen, neither in bad times when the economy was doing very bad, nor when the change of the government took place that caused turmoil in Albania,” said Bledar.

loans.use: to pay off the clients whose phones where stolen during the burglary of the store

loans.name: Everlyne's Group

texts.en:
Everlyne is 38 years old and has six children. She is a group leader representing her group comprised of six farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. 

Everlyne has been farming with One Acre Fund for several years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2009. This decision was largely a result of her desire to make more farmer friends in her community. Allthough she described her last harvest as good, she believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Everlyne has also decided to purchase two solar lights as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to have light during dark hours, thereby enabling her children to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Everlyne's Group will be able to receive a total of seven solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 2.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Manushaqe

texts.en:
Manushaqe, or ‘Violet’ in English, is a married mother of one who has been growing garlic, wheat, potatoes and fodder for the animals in large quantities for the past ten years. Manushaqe also has a dairy cow. She owns the land upon which she grows, and has given for free about 2000 square meters to one of her neighbors who is extremely poor.

“Sometimes, we have to give, in order to get. My neighbor had children, yet she had no piece of land where she could plant for her family,” she said during the interview. 

Manushaqe has requested this loan to buy pesticides for her land.

loans.use: to buy pesticides for her land

loans.name: Mpunga Group

texts.en:
Maimuna, who is in her late thirties, is single with two children who are still in school. She has been operating a tricycle transportation for three years. She works from 8:00 a.m. to 10 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Maimuna's fifth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy a motorcycle and service her tricycle, and she has paid back all her loans successfully. She used the profit to pay school fees, to save some funds in her bank account, and for loan repayment and household expenses. She will use this loan to buy another tricycle.  She dreams of being an international businesswoman.

Maimuna will share this loan with her loan group Mpunga, which has three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy another tricycle.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 22 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica al cultivo de maíz, cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en los graneros que muestra la fotografía para luego venderlos en los alrededores de la zona donde el reside, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra salir adelante, el joven vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The 22 year old young man has his face pixelated as he lives in a high-risk area. 

He works growing corn. When his crop is ready he stores it in the silos shown in the photograph to sell later in the surrounding areas where he lives. He will get ahead with what he obtains from the sale. He lives in his own home with his life companion. 

He is asking for a loan in order to buy fertilizers, compost, pest control, herbicides, etc., and thus be able to have better income for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, compost, pest control, herbicides, etc.

loans.name: Alina

texts.en:
Alina is from Qaradzor village, where she lives with her two children. Her husband is a migrant worker in a neighbouring country.

To tackle financial hardships, Alina started a clothing sales business four years ago. She trades in clothing supplies from her house, and over those years of hard work was able to have a loyal clientele.

Alina asks for this loan to be able to enrich her clothing supplies and sell them to her customers.

Her loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides business start-up loans to informal businesses that do not qualify through normal channels.

loans.use: to pay for new stock of clothing for her retail business.

loans.name: Cherotich

texts.en:
Cherotich is a progressive 35-year-old farmer from Kiptenden village in the Litein area of Kenya. Litein's high altitude and its cool and wet climate make it ideal for two kinds of farming: tea and dairy. Cherotich is a dairy farmer whose main income comes from the milk that she sells in the nearby market called Kapkoros.

Cherotich is planning to venture into cash crop farming, as her land is big enough to support the new venture. The only impediment seems to be lack of adequate capital. She has saved enough over time to cover most of the expenses, but she still needs help to acquire the tools necessary for crop cultivation. 

Cherotich is therefore seeking a loan of KES 80,000 to pay for farm implements. It will be a hard and labour intensive task to break the ground and to do proper seedbed preparation, so she needs farm tools that are cheap, modern and in good condition. Your loan will enable her to afford suitable tools for the job. 

Increased income from the new venture will broaden the family's opportunites to enjoy adequate food.

loans.use: to buy farm implements

loans.name: Rafael

texts.en:
Rafael is a constructor from Stepanavan town. He lives with his two sons and his wife. Rafael's elder son is an army officer. Rafael receives orders from local people in Stepanavan town and provides cosmetic repair work to houses.
 
Rafael has requested this loan so he can purchase tools and materials needed for construction work. He would like to update his tools and materials and improve the quality of service he provides to customers.
 
His loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides business start-up loans to informal businesses that do not qualify through normal channels.

loans.use: to pay for tools and materials for construction work

loans.name: Florence's Group

texts.en:
Florence, pictured above, is married and has four children. She is a group leader and is representing her group, formed by eight farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. She joined One Acre Fund for the first time in 2009 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers. 

With a portion of this loan, Florence will not only purchase maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvest season, but also two solar lights. Receiving two solar lights as part of her loan means that she will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. Florence plans to use the profits she gains this year to send her children to school.

Florence’s Group will use the inputs received from this loan to plant a total of 4.25 acres of land. They will also receive 11 solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost-efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvest season, as well as two solar lights.

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en:
Kousar is 35 years old and a married woman. She has been doing business in animal sales with the help of her husband for many years. Her business has provided her family with a decent life. She is a mother of five children. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing. 

Kousar has requested a loan of 30,000 PKR. She intends to utilize this loan amount to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers. She is hopeful that her business will generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers.

loans.name: Kalsoom

texts.en:
Kalsoom is a 39-year-old married woman. She is a mother of seven children. She has been operating an animal sales business for many years to bear her household expenditures.  

Now, she has requested a loan of 30,000 PKR. She wants to use this loan amount to purchase more cattle to resell in the market. She desires to improve her standard of living through all her efforts.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market.

loans.name: Mumtaz

texts.en:
Mumtaz is 40 years old; she is a married woman. She deals in a business of selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, brings them up, and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income.

She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase more animals to inflate her sales.

She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to inflate her sales and income level.

loans.name: Shama

texts.en:
Shama, aged 55, is a married woman. She operates a business where she rears and sells animals. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them in the market at higher prices. Shama makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She also sells milk to generate extra income. 

Shama needs to improve her business to meet her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and has applied for a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase more animals to increase her sales. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, Shama will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to increase her sales.

loans.name: Jose Valentin

texts.es:
Valentin, de 63 años de edad, está casado, no estudio y tiene 8 hijos, pero todos ya tienen sus propios hogares.

Valentin, depende de padres trabajadores, que se dedicaban al cultivo de maíz, frijol y café, esto fue lo que aprendió de su padre.

El dinero del crédito lo necesita para comprar abono para sembrar 1,000 arbolitos de café,  Valentin tiene que hacer esta inversión nuevamente porque la cosecha anterior la perdió debido a una plaga llamada roya.

Su sueño más grande es recuperar la inversión de su cultivo, pues él ya es de avanzada edad y considera que con las ganancias que obtenga de la cosecha podrá tener los ingresos suficientes para comprar los alimentos necesarios para bastante tiempo.
texts.en:
Valentin is 63 years old, married and never went to school. He has eight children all of whom now have their own families. Valentin is from hard-working parents who grew corn, beans and coffee. He learned this trade from his father.

Valentin needs the money from the loan to buy fertilizer so he can plant 1,000 young coffee plants.  He must make this investment again because he lost his previous crop to a roya outbreak.  His biggest dream is to recover his investment in his crop. He is already at an advanced age and believes that with the money he makes from his crop, he will be able to have enough income to buy the food he needs for a long time.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to plant 1,000 coffee plants.

loans.name: Singida Group

texts.en:
Mary, who is in her early 40s, is a divorcee with two children who are still in school.  She has been running a retail shop for four years now.  She works from 6:30 a.m. to 10 p.m. daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Mary's eighth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to start selling water and sodas, the out of stock items in the shop, and has paid back all her loans successfully. She used the profit to pay college fees and covered household expenses. She will use this loan to buy the missing items in her retail shop. She dreams of becoming a rich woman.

Mary will share this loan with her loan group, "Singida," which consists of five members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy the missing items in her retail shop.

loans.name: Shahmim

texts.en:
Shahmim is a 49-year-old married woman and a mother of eight children. She is working hard to fulfill their demands, including food, health, clothing, and education.

She and her husband (also shown in the photo) have been doing agriculture work for some years. They grow different vegetables and fruits and sell them in the local market.

She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. In order to purchase different types of seeds and packs of insecticides and pesticides, Shahmim has currently applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR. This would help her to grow more crops, which ultimately will help in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase different types of seeds and packs of insecticides and pesticides.

loans.name: Ghulam  Fatima

texts.en:
Ghulam Fatima is a 30-year-old married woman. She has been in the work of hand embroidery. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand, and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home.

To help her to continue her operations, she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy spools of thread in different colors, along with packs of beads, sequins, and stones for embellishment. This will allow her to cater to more customers consistently. She is hopeful to get an increase in her income by targeting more customers.

She dreams for her bright future and desires to build her own house.

loans.use: to buy spools of thread in different colors, along with packs of beads, sequins, and stones for embellishment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To complete construction of the household's toilet facility

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en:
Fifty-one-year-old Kousar is a married woman with seven children. The man shown in the photo is her son. He has been running a food stall for a period of about four years. He earns sufficient income to cover the family’s expenditures. 

For the improvement of her son’s business, Kousar has availed herself of a Murabaha loan of 35,000 PKR to buy stock of crockery and utensils, along with stock of oil, spices and food items. It will help her son to increase his sales and profits, as well.

loans.use: to buy stock of crockery and utensils, along with stock of oil, spices and food items.

loans.name: Dave

texts.en:
Dave wants your financial help to replace a dairy cow that unfortunately was stolen at night with its grownup calf. 

She is 55 years old and has two children, age 20 and 26, with the oldest working in Greece.
 
“I woke up one morning, and I suddenly saw that my animals weren’t in the stable. I got so very upset that I couldn’t keep my tears,” said Dave. 

She owns about 3,000 square meters of agricultural land, where she plants seasonal veggies only for the family, fodder for the animals that she previously had, and some grapevines and orchards such as plums and figs. 

Dave receives a little pension of $114/month, and her husband gets $216/month, as well.

loans.use: to replace a cow that was recently stolen from the stable

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha is 41 years old and a married woman. She is the mother of six children. One of her sons (also shown in the photo with her) is running a small general store to make enough to support his family circle. He is making a great effort to support his family. However, he faces a financial problem in the growth of his business. 

For this reason, Aisha has accessed a Murabaha loan of 25,000 PKR to buy more packs of biscuits, grains, and cleaning products to meet the demand of customers, time after time. She is positive about her son’s future earnings and will spend part of the income on improving their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more packs of biscuits, grains and cleaning products to meet the demand of customers, time after time.

loans.name: Eva

texts.es:
Eva, de 53 años de edad, no fue a la escuela, no puede leer ni escribir, está casada y su esposos se dedicó por mucho tiempo a la agricultura, pero un día decidió viajar al extranjero en busca de mejores condiciones para él y su familia, tienen 5 hijos, pero todos ya están acompañados.

Eva, se ha dedicado desde hace 10 años a trabajar en una venta de carne, de donde obtiene ingresos, para cubrir los gastos de la casa, solo 2 hijos viven con ella, pero ya tienen sus parejas.

El dinero del crédito lo necesita para reparar su vivienda, porque está en malas condiciones y teme que suceda un accidente.

Ella sueña con tener un negocio de carne propio y tener empleados porque ella se cansada muy rápido por su edad.
texts.en:
Eva is 53 years old and never went to school. She doesn't know how to read or write. She is married and her husband has been a farmer for a long time. But one day he decided to travel overseas to look for a better situation for him and his family. They have five children, but all of them are married.

For the past ten years Eva has worked at a butcher shop to earn money to cover her household expenses.  Only two of her children live with her, but they have spouses.

The money from the loan will be used to make repairs to Eva's house because it is in bad shape and she is afraid that an accident could happen. She dreams of having her own butcher shop with employees because her age is causing her to tire easily.

loans.use: to make repairs to her house.

loans.name: Dédé

texts.fr: Dédé est une femme mariée qui habite dans le quartier de Kodjoviakopé avec trois enfants. Agée de 60 ans, Dédé prépare des beignets qu’elle vend dans son quartier et sa prestation satisfait grandement ses consommateurs. Dédé achète ses provisions une fois par mois dans une boutique du quartier. Pour acheter quelques sacs de blé, de sucre, de charbon et un bidon d’huile, Dédé sollicite ce prêt pour réaliser sa commande afin d’avoir plus de revenu.
texts.en: Dédé is a married woman who lives in the Kodjoviakopé district with her three children. She is 60 years old and makes beignets, which she sells in her neighborhood. Her range of services has been satisfying her consumers very much. Dédé purchases her provisions once a month at a district store. To purchase a few sacks of wheat, sugar, and charcoal, as well as a container of oil, she is requesting this loan, so as to fulfill her order and thus obtain more revenues.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of wheat, oil, sugar, and charcoal

loans.name: Yeredeme Group

texts.fr: AICHE est celle qui a levé sa main gauche sur la photo. Elle est malienne, âgée de 30 ans, mariée et  mère  de 3 enfants dont 2 sont scolarisés. Son mari est un cultivateur. Elle pratique l’élevage de moutons.  Exerçant cette activité depuis  4 ans, elle s’approvisionne dans le marché local puis revendre ses animaux dans le même marché. une éleveuse, AICHE fait recourt  à l’IMF pour accroitre ses  activités d’élevage. Elle rêve d’avoir l’opportunité de faire l’embouche des bœufs. Le profit qu’elle réalise la permet d’aider son mari à satisfaire les besoins des enfants et les frais scolaires. Elle compte sur le  RMCR de continuer  à lui accordé des prêts pour mieux mener ses activités.
texts.en:
AICHE is the one in the photo with her left hand raised. She is Malian, 30 years old, and a married mother of three children, of whom two are in school. Her husband is a farmer. AICHE raises sheep. In this business for four years, she makes her purchases at the local market and then resells her animals at the same market. 

Raising livestock, AICHE has turned to the microfinance institution to grow her livestock business. She dreams of having the opportunity to be in the cattle-fattening business. The profit she makes enables her to help out her husband in meeting the children’s needs and in covering schooling costs. 

AICHE is counting on RMCR to continue according her loans for her to do her work better.

loans.use: to purchase sheep to raise and then resell later

loans.name: Mawoulani

texts.fr: Célibataire et âgée de 32 ans, Mawoulani est une femme qui vit avec un enfant à sa charge. Mawoulani habite à Adéwui et vend des produits de commerce général et des recharges de crédit virtuelles dans le quartier afin d’avoir le bénéfice nécessaire pour leur épanouissement. Pour parvenir à ses fins, Mawoulani s’approvisionne deux fois par mois chez ses fournisseurs. Pour commander des cartons d’eau minérale, des recharges de crédit et des sachets plastiques, Mawoulani demande ce prêt pour réaliser son achat et disposer d’un revenu afin d’aider son enfant dans son éducation.
texts.en: An unmarried woman, 32 years old, Mawoulani lives with her child she supports in Adéwui and sells commercial products and virtual phone-minutes cards in her district, so as to obtain the profits necessary for her family to thrive. To reach her goals, Mawoulani obtains her goods twice a month from suppliers. For boxes of mineral water, phone cards, and plastic bags, Mawoulani is asking for this loan to make her purchases and to make the income to aid her child’s education.

loans.use: to purchase 17 boxes of mineral water, some plastic bags, and phone-minutes cards

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 27 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, posee 4 años de experiencia en el cultivo, inicio con capital propio, cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en los graneros que muestra la fotografía y luego los comercializa en los pueblos aledaños, la joven es madre soltera vive en casa propia con su hija, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes, agroquímicos entre otras cosas para sus cultivos y asi poder tener una muy buena cosecha para tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
The young woman whose face is pixelated is 27 years old and lives in a high-risk area. She grows corn and beans and has four years of experience in producing these crops. The borrower started with her own capital. When her harvest is ready, she stores her crops in granaries (like the one shown in the photo) and then sells them in neighboring towns. The borrower is a single mother who lives in her own home along with her daughter.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy fertilizers, agrochemicals, and other supplies for her crops. This will enable her to have a very good harvest so that she can earn more income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, agrochemicals, and other supplies for her crops.

loans.name: Sumaira

texts.en:
Sumaira is a 34-year-old married woman and mother of two children. Her husband (also shown in the photo) some time ago started a van driving business.

Sumaira's husband owns one Suzuki van and needs some financial help. Therefore, Sumaira has requested a Murabaha loan of 30,000 PKR for her husband. He will use the amount to pay for repair and maintenance costs of the van.

Sumaira is hopeful that her husband’s business will prosper and their standard of living will improve.

loans.use: to pay for repair and maintenance costs of the van.

loans.name: Ablewavi

texts.fr: A 60 ans, Abléwavi est une femme veuve et avec ses trois enfants, elle vit dans le quartier d’Adobokomé. Abléwavi est une marchande de charbons de bois, des balais et des produits d’alimentations générales à la devanture de sa maison. Abléwavi s’approvisionne une fois par mois dans un marché local du quartier. Abléwavi réalise une très bonne rentabilité dans son commerce. Abléwavi nécessite ce crédit pour acheter des sacs de charbons de bois et des balais pour gagner des bénéfices et venir en aide à l’éducation scolaire de ses enfants.
texts.en: Abléwavi, aged 60, is a widow and lives with her three children in the Adobokomé district. She is a vendor of charcoal, brooms, and general consumer items in front of her house. She gets her supplies once a month at a local market in the district. Abléwavi makes a very good profit in her business. She has need of this loan to purchase sacks of charcoal and some brooms to earn profits and to aid her children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase 3 sacks of charcoal and some brooms

loans.name: Yudis

texts.es: Yudis de 29 años de edad se dedica al negocio de fotografía, desde el 16 de agosto del año 2004, actividad tradicional en la familia, que Yudis decidió continuar. Además de hacer hermosas fotografías, también se dedica a la marquetería y vende la fotografía enmarcada como valor agregado. Yudis trabaja de Lunes a sábados, desde las 5 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde, ofrece a sus clientes crédito y contado. Como la meta de crecimiento de yudis no se detiene, sueña con mantenerse en el mercado muy competitiva y lograr un crecimiento importante en su negocio, para conseguir una mayor calidad de vida. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará una cámara profesional y una impresora,  con ello planea incrementar la calidad de sus productos y servicios, además que impactará la decisión de compra de sus servicios por parte de sus clientes
texts.en:
Yudis is 29 years old and has been working in the photography business since August 16, 2004. This business is a tradition in her family which she decided to continue. Besides taking beautiful photographs, she also works at marketing and selling the framed photography as an added value. 

Yudis works from Monday to Saturday from 5 a.m. until 5 p.m.. She sells to her customers for cash and credit. As Yudis' goal of growing her company cannot be stopped, she dreams of being able to continue in a very competitive market and to achieve significant growth in her business, in order to have a better quality of life. 

She is currently applying for a Kiva loan, her first one with Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will buy a professional camera and a printer. This will allow her to improve the quality of her products and services, and will impact upon her clients' decisions to buy her services.

loans.use: to buy a professional camera and a printer.

loans.name: Pamela's Group

texts.en:
Pamela, a 33-year-old married mother of three, is described as a very trustworthy person. The leader representing her group of nine farmers in Webuye District in Kenya, she is very excited to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

The decision to join One Acre Fund was largely a result of Pamela's desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Apart from receiving farming inputs, she is also purchasing a solar light as part of her loan, which is very exciting to her as she will now be able to have light during dark hours for her children to study by. With the profits that she gains from this year’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

Pamela and her group will receive a total of eight solar lights as well as input loans of maize and fertilizer to plant a total of five acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Jean Damascene

texts.en:
Jean Damascene is a 35-year-old married father of three children ranging in age from eight to 12 years, all attending school. He has been growing rice for the past eight years, and his wife is also a farmer. With this loan from Kiva, Jean Damascene would like to buy fertilizers for his rice. The profits from the business will be used to buy a piece of land and to improve his welfare.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to grow rice

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
The lady in the photo is Dorcas. She is 52 years old, single, and blessed with four children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in 2013.

Dorcas runs a beauty salon and cosmetic shop where she plaits clients' hair and sells beauty products. Having gone through HiH EA enterprise training, she is now able to manage her business well.

She is borrowing a Kiva loan to stock up on hair gel, weaves and shampoo that will help meet her customers' needs and thus maximize her profits. Income from the business will enable her to cater for her children’s education and for the family's basic needs.

Dorcas is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for their support, and she promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy more hair gel, weaves and shampoo that will help meet her customers' needs.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 23 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la venta de cocos desde hace 7 años, su negocio está ubicado en el mercado en una zona muy transitada, con las ventas que realiza logra salir adelante el joven vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y su hija, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas cocos por mayor y asi poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: This young man—whose face has been pixelated because he is 23 years old and lives in a high-risk area—has earned his living selling coconuts for seven years. His business is located in the market in a very busy area. With the sales he makes, he is able to provide for himself. The young man lives in his own house with his life companion and his daughter. He is requesting a loan for the purchase of more coconuts at wholesale in order to be able to have better income for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more coconuts at wholesale

loans.name: Dinesh

texts.en:
Dinesh is very glad that all his Kiva lenders helped him overhaul his tractor. He thanks all his lenders for such a great job and repaid his loan a long time ago.

In the previous season, the paddy price was very low and Dinesh could not save much. He wants to continue with his rice cultivation and lacks finances to buy fertilizers and diesel oil.

For this reason, he again wants to borrow SRD 10.000.

loans.use: To buy inputs for his rice cultivation.

loans.name: Arjumand

texts.en: Arjumand is a 35-year-old married woman who has been doing a business of cattle purchase and sales with the help of her husband (also shown in the photo) for the past 10 years. After raising small animals for a year or two, her husband sells them in the local market. Her business has provided her family with a decent life. She is a mother of five children. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with a good education, food and clothing. For the growth of her business, she has availed a Murabaha loan of 30,000 PKR to purchase more cattle. She is hopeful that her business will generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle to generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.name: Joseph's Group

texts.en:
Joseph is 53 years old and has seven children. He is a group leader and is representing his group formed by 15 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. 

Joseph has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely a result of his desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods and, although he described his last harvest as good, he believes he could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Joseph also decided to purchase two solar lights as part of his loan, which he is very excited about, as it will allow him to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Joseph's Group will be able to receive a total of 13 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 10.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Lugano Group

texts.en:
Agnesi, who is in her early 30s, is single, with one daughter who is still at school. She has been running a retail shop since 2015. She works from 8am to 9pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Agnesi's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this loan to buy the out-of-stock items for the retail shop. She dreams of owning a very big shop.

Agnesi will share this loan with her loan group, Lugano Group, which consists of three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy the out-of-stock items for the retail shop.

loans.name: Emily's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Emily, often described as an extremely trustworthy person. She is 26 years old and, as a group leader, she is representing her group of 13 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya.  She is married and has four children.

Emily is returning this season to work with One Acre Fund again as this means that she is able to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds, which is why she decided to join in the first place. Emily says that she is happy to have made that decision because, since she first joined in 2012, she has been able to consistently feed her family, which has improved her day-to-day life significantly. Emily will use the profits from this season to buy a cow.

The group will use this loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer to plant a total of 6.25 acres. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light with this loan, the group will also receive a total of five solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more boxes of bottled water and bags of sachet drinking water to resell

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es: Gladis de 60 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella se dedica al cultivo de maíz y adicional  eso también vende antojitos, tiene 16 años de dedicarse a la actividad de cultivo, cundo su cosecha ya esta lista la comercializa en los pueblos aledaños y ya tiene clientes establecidos, con lo   que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, pesticidas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra la fotografía y así seguir con sus cultivos para tener mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Gladis is 60 years old and lives in her own home along her husband and two children. She grows corn, but she also sells snacks. Gladis has been farming for 16 years. When her harvest is ready, she sells her crops in the neighboring towns where she has established customers. With the income she earns from her sales, Gladis is able to cover some of her household expenses.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy seeds, fertilizers, compost, pesticides, and other supplies so that she can improve the land that is shown in the photograph. As a result, she can continue growing her crops so that she can have better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, compost, pesticides, and other supplies in order to improve her land.

loans.name: Chin

texts.en:
Chin (here in pictured) is 49 years old and lives in Posen Chey district, Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She has been married since 1993 and has three daughters.  One is a cleaner and the others are attending school.

Chin has been a farmer for thirty years, while her husband has been a construction worker for twelve years. She would like to apply for a loan to purchase a motorbike for her daughter to take to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her daughters to take to work.

loans.name: Zhamoloy

texts.ru:
Жамолой замужняя женщина. Ей 54 года. Она с мужем, с сыном и его женой живут на районе Вахш. Жамолой с мужем занимаются земледелием, каждый год сажают сельскохозяйственные культуры и от продажи урожая они живут. В этом году, у ее семьи не хватило денег, чтобы завершить посев урожая и Жамолой видит выход из ситуации только в получении кредита. За счет денежных средств она приобретет минеральные удобрения, и обработает ими почку и урожай. Без минеральных удобрений они не смогут получить хороший урожай на следующий сезон. Жамолой сама обратилась за кредитом, потому, что у Хумо больше поддерживает клиентов женщин,  упрощаем им условия кредитования и разрабатывает новые продукты поддерживающих женщин предпринимательниц.
Жамолой надеется, что лендеры Kiva помогут ей, и она будет в ожидании богатого урожай на следующий сезон.
texts.en: Zhamoloy is a 54-year-old married woman.  She lives in the Vakhsh district with her husband, her son and her daughter-in-law.  Zhamoloy and her husband work as farmers.  Every year, they plant crops and live on the earnings they get from their harvest.  This year, they don't have enough money to plant crops and Zhamoloy sees no other solution than to take a loan.  She will be using her money to buy mineral fertilizers in order to prepare her land for the next harvest.  Without mineral fertilizers, Zhamoloy and her husband will not be able to get a good harvest during the next season.  Zhamoloy has decided to apply for this loan herself because MLO Humo particularly supports female clients, simplifying their lending conditions and developing new products to support women entrepreneurs.  Zhamoloy hopes that Kiva lenders will help her.  She is expecting a rich harvest next season.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers for the planting season.

loans.name: Tosigwegwe

texts.en:
Tosigwegwe, who is in her mid-40's, is divorced with four children. Two are grown-ups and two are still in school.  She has been a tailor for two years now.  She works from 9 AM  to 6 PM daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Tosigwegwe's 10th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to buy one sewing machine and sewing equipment, and has paid back all her loans successfully.  She used the profit to pay school fees and covered household expenses.  

She will use this loan to buy materials and sewing equipment for her tailoring business.  She dreams of adding another sewing machine and opening an office for her business.

Tosigwegwe will make sure she pays the loan according to the loan schedule.

loans.use: to buy materials and sewing equipment for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Gamzogul

texts.en:
Gamzogul is a hardworking woman who was born in 1956. She is living in a remote district, and she is married and has two children. She is a brave, honest and kind person. 

Gamzogul has had a business for about twenty years working on the land, planting agricultural products. She is planting onion, pepper and tomato now. She is planning to widen her business. 

Gamzogul is hoping to be financially supported by Kiva project members. She is asking for 2,000 Somoni (TJS) to buying agricultural products and fertilizers.

loans.use: To buy agricultural products and fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sheets and mats and to pay for workers.

loans.name: Nuru

texts.en:
NURU, who is in her early 40s, is married with two children; one is in school and one is still small. She has been running a business selling bricks for eight years now.  She works from 8 AM to 6:30 PM daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.  

This will be NURU's 10th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to buy a bricks machine. She used to have a wooden type to make bricks but it used to take a long time and used a a lot of energy. But, now, she makes bricks faster and without using a lot of energy. She also bought sand ane cement and has paid all of her loans successfully. She will use this loan to buy cement, sand, and water for making more and better bricks.  She dreams of owning a food shop.

Nuru will make sure she pays her loan on the loan schedule.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, and water for making more and better bricks

loans.name: Surayo

texts.en:
Surayo is a courteous, assiduous and responsible woman. She was born in 1975. She is living in a remote district. She is married and has four children. She and her husband are trying to educate their children and teach them to behave well. She tries to be useful and helpful to support her husband with finances and cover needed expenses of their everyday life.

She is getting a loan from IMON to help her family to escape from diverse family shortages. She has a business of planting vegetables in her yard. She is planning to buy fertilizers for her land. Surayo requested 1,000 somoni from Kiva to buy fertilizers for her land.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her land

loans.name: Dalia

texts.en:
Dalia is a 22-year-old single woman from Lebanon. She lives with her parents and three siblings, working together to meet the needs of life and improve their way of living. 

Dalia does her best to support her father financially with her hairdressing occupation. She started her job in 2012 by opening an equipped room at her house. She welcomes her customers in a very lovely way. 

Today, to better develop her business, she is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. for the purpose of acquiring new tools, supplies, and a table. She looks forward to developing her job and thereby increasing her income, and she is planning also to sell beauty products and cosmetics in the future.

loans.use: acquiring new tools, supplies, and a table

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to enable her to get enough capital to educate her children

loans.name: Nuriniso

texts.en:
Nuriniso is an active woman with almost twenty years of experience in agriculture. She is a widow because her husband had heart problems and died. She has two children. She participated in training, which was provided by IMON for startup clients. She gained a lot from that training and decided to start a new business in agriculture.

She is planning to buy livestock for keeping, feeding and selling. She has enough land to keep livestock and plant agricultural products at home. Planting agricultural products would be a source of additional income to improve her standard of living. Nuriniso is an honest, hardworking and kind person. She requests a loan to buy livestock and agricultural products to start her new business.

loans.use: to buy cattle and agricultural products

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy wheat, corn, and quinoa.

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en:
Eduardo, 42, is a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. He is married to Vangeline, a homemaker, and has one child who is in high school. Eduardo works hard to meet their everyday needs and to support their child's schooling. 

Eduardo has been operating a tricycle passenger transport business for five years. His tricycle is one that carries up to four passengers. In the Philippines, especially in the provinces of Silang, a tricycle is a common means of transportation. Jeepneys and buses are limited and very few people own a vehicle. The townspeople usually take a tricycle from their homes to market, church, to their friend’s homes and to other destinations within their community. They even take transportation from one town to the other. 

Eduardo earns a minimum of 500 PHP a day. To help him continue his transport business, he is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan, which he will use to pay for tires and the maintenance of his tricycle. It is important that his tricycle is always in a good running condition, to ensure efficient service and steady income. 

Eduardo aims to have another tricycle unit to increase his business. He wants to give his children the best education and lead a simple and decent life. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week and it is where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God he studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance and tires for his tricycle unit.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
This is Vivian, 39, resident of Manila, Philippines. Her husband is Antonio, a mechanic, and she is the mother of 5 children. Together with her husband, she manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Vivian operates a retail business. What she basically does is buy garlic and onions from a wholesaler and repacks and sells them at a profit. Her products can range from bulb onions to local garlic and other similar products. Customers are attracted to buy due to her low prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, Vivian is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan. She will use the loan to buy more quantities and varieties of onions and garlic to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Vivian dreams of expanding her store and helping her children finish their studies. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of bulb onions and garlic to sell in the market.

loans.name: Leizel

texts.en: Leizel is 35 years old and married with four children. Three of her children are in school. Leizel works hard to provide for her family.
