She has been running a general store in the Philippines for 14 years, and she also earns an income from food vending. Liezel has requested a 16,000 PHP loan through Kiva's partner, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), to purchase more groceries to sell. She has had 18 loans from NWTF and has repaid all of them. Leizel aspires to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Eminda

texts.en:
Eminda is 44 years old and married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and she has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like noodles, canned goods, and soft drinks.

Eminda has borrowed and repaid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

She aspires to save enough money to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like noodles, canned goods, and soft drinks

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Aileen is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Aileen is 38 years old, and all of her children are in school.

Aileen has a food vending business in the Philippines. Aileen requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy ingredients like flour, sugar, cooking oil and other spices for her food business. Aileen has been in this business for eight years. 

In the future, Aileen would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like flour, sugar, cooking and other spices for her food business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand his horticultural farm

loans.name: Virgie

texts.en:
Virgie is 47 years old and married.

Virgie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 10,000 PHP through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Virgie has been in this business for thirty years and sells a variety of items, such as canned goods, soft drinks and other groceries. 

In the future, Virgie would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en:
Marietta, a 46-year-old married mother of seven, is a very hard working entrepreneur. For the past four years, she has been buying and selling scrap in the Philippines. 

Marietta has requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional scrap for her business. In the future, she would like to build and expand her enterprise to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional scrap for her business

loans.name: Nyongesa's Group

texts.en:
Nyongesa is 57 years old and has nine children. He is a group leader and is representing his group formed by thirteen farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. 

Nyongesa has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2009. This decision was largely a result of his desire to earn enough to send his children to school and, although he described his last harvest as good, he believes he could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Nyongesa also decided to purchase two solar lights as part of his loan, which he is very excited about, as it will allow him to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Nyongesa's Group will be able to receive a total of 14 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 7 acres.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Fredy

texts.es:
Fredy, se encuentra casado, comparte la vivienda con su esposa y sus hijos, instaló una venta de productos varios hace ocho años, desde entonces ha ido adquiriendo experiencia para atender a sus clientes, los cuales prefieren visitar su negocio por la honestidad y variedad de productos que les ofrece.
Para mantener a sus clientes satisfechos está solicitando un préstamo que invertirá en huevos, bebidas, azúcar, granos básicos, detergentes, jabón y otro tipo de producto para reducir las necesidades de sus clientes, espera que sus ventas sean mayores y generar nuevas ganancias para cubrir las necesidades de su hogar y dar a sus hijos educación de calidad.
Fredy sueña con pagar sus deudas, tener los recursos para ayudar a otras personas necesitadas y ver que sus hijos culminen una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Fredy is married, and he shares his home with his wife and their children. He started a store selling various products eight years ago. Since then, he has gained experience in taking care of his clients, who prefer to visit his business because of his honesty and the variety of products he offers them.

To keep his clients satisfied, he is requesting a loan that he will invest in eggs, drinks, sugar, basic grains, detergents, soap, and other types of products to meet his clients’ needs. He hopes that his sales will be bigger and that he will generate new earnings to cover his household expenses and to give his children a quality education.

Fredy dreams of paying off his debts, having resources to help other people in need, and seeing his children finishing a university degree.

loans.use: to invest in eggs, drinks, sugar, basic grains, detergents, soap, and other types of products to meet his clients' needs.

loans.name: Monicah

texts.en:
Monicah is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over nine years, she has operated a  food cafe business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the 30,000 KES she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Rezo

texts.en:
Rezo is a 43-year-old man, from the village of Gvishtibi. He lives alone and works on family-owned agricultural land. The income he gets is really insignificant, and consists of 60 GEL per month. He lives under poverty, and has great desire to start another activity. 

For this purpose, he has requested a loan. His loan application was rejected several times because of Rezo's poor living conditions and lack of experience. The start up program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enabled him to get a loan of 1,150 GEL for purchasing the necessary tools for his new business initiative. Rezo will start working on furniture making, and will get private orders among his and other nearby villages. 

The business will be a great help to this motivated man, as he will get the chance to make a significant source of income to stabilize his financial condition. Rezo awaits your support and kindness.

loans.use: To purchase tools and start working on furniture making

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel un padre de familia de 47 años, tiene una linda familia de 4 hijos de las edades entre 15 y 25 años, vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Manuel para que a su familia no le haga falta nada, trabaja de sol a sol desde hace 5 años en las grandes  fincas de su comunidad  cortando caña de azúcar, pero para el este trabajo es muy importante porque es de lo que él trabaja y vive.
El gran sueño de Manuel es ver a sus hijos convertidos en grandes profesionales, pero una de las dificultades que él tiene es que no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para poder solventar los gastos de sus hijos en la escuela, pero él quiere que sus hijos tengan todo lo necesario para poder llegar hacer profesionales de bien, por tal motivo él solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para pagar colegiaturas, compra de libros y cuadernos. Manuel tiene las esperanzas puestas en este crédito, para poderles brindar a sus hijos una mejor educación.
texts.en:
Manuel is the father of a family and is 47 years old. He has a beautiful family with 4 children aged between 15 and 25 years old. He lives in the community of Sololá.

So that his family lacks nothing, Manuel has worked from sun up to sun down for 5 years in the large farms in his community, cutting sugar cane. For him, this work is very important because it is what he does and lives for.

Manuel’s big dream is to see his children become big professionals, but one of his challenges is that he doesn’t have enough money to be able to cover his children’s expenses for school. Nonetheless, he wants his children to have everything they need to be able to become good professionals. 

For this reason, he requests a loan that he will use to pay school fees and to buy book and notebooks. Manuel has hopes pinned on this loan, since it will allow him to offer his children a better education.

loans.use: to buy book and notebooks and to pay for school fees.

loans.name: Tazeem

texts.en: Forty-five-year-old Tazeem is a married woman and a mother of eight children. Her husband is also shown in the photo. Their son is driving a rickshaw to provide transportation services in his city to passengers. In this way, he is able to meet his family expenses. Currently, Tazeem has availed a Murabaha loan of 25,000 PKR for her son to bear the maintenance costs and change the tires of the rickshaw. She is hopeful that her son’s earnings will increase in the near future.

loans.use: to bear the maintenance costs and change the tires of the rickshaw.

loans.name: Ku Lar Su Village Group

texts.en:
This community is located Ku Lar Su Village, Myanmar Ayeyarwaddy Delta region. In this community, six CBO (Community Based Organization) members oversee a group of 20 village customers. 

This loan will help some group members to purchase both ducks and ducklings. The remaining group members will use the funds to purchase high quality feed, costing $20 for five days feeding 100 ducks. Each of these uses will boost villager income from more duck eggs and more revenue from duck sales. In addition to ducks, many Ku Lar Su villagers raise pigs and chickens. Most of the men in the village are farmers and some households also plant seasonal vegetables.

As most of the villagers are famers, pictured are the borrowers with the cattle that will be used in the crop farm. Others are the CBO members from Ku Lar Su Village, named U Zaw, U Brother, U Aye, U Ahlan, U Ka and Daw Khin.  U Zaw (second from left in the photo) is seventeen years old. He farms his family's farm and also looks after the livestock of ducks and ducklings. He has three siblings, two brothers currently in school and a sister who helps with the duck raising. For additional income, U Zaw's family plants seasonal vegetables. 

With the Proximity's loan, U Zaw will purchase ducklings as well as high quality feed. This will boost income from more duck eggs, and will generate a larger payoff when the ducks are fully grown and sold.  This additional income is critical for U Zaw's family as prices for rice were especially low in the most recent harvesting season.

loans.use: to purchase ducks and high quality feed

loans.name: Shamsa

texts.en:
Shamsa is a 29-year-old married woman, and the mother of three children. The man shown in the photo is Shamsa’s husband, who is running a business selling tires and different types of batteries for various vehicles to meet the family's expenses.

For the improvement of her husband’s business, Shamsa has availed herself of a Murabaha loan of 35,000 PKR. It helped her husband in purchasing good quality tires for increasing sales and profits.

loans.use: to purchase good quality tires for increasing sales and profits

loans.name: Mobil

texts.en:
Mobil is 38 years old, married and in the past year his second child was born. They have been living in Fuzuli region near the war zone like an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) over 22 years. His elder child goes to school. Mobil has been in the animal breeding business for five years. 

A while ago he applied to Komak Company for his loan in the amount of 1,300 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). With this loan he wants to buy cows. He says he is very thankful to Kiva organization and lenders for everything. In the future, he wants to increase his business and to make repairs in his house.

loans.use: to buy cows to increase business. In the future, he wants to make repairs in his house.

loans.name: White Rose Group

texts.en:
Fanil, who is in his early 30's, is single with one son who is still at school.  He has been running two projects, a retail shop and a chip-selling business, for four years now.  He works from 6 AM to 9 PM daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Fanil's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loan to buy retail shop inventory like sugar, salt, beans rice, flours, cooking oil, and charcoal, and has paid back his loan successfully.  He used the profit to pay school fees and covered household expenses.  

He will use this loan to buy shop inventory, Irish potatoes, cooking oil, and charcoal for cooking chips. He dreams of improving his business to the international level.

Fanil will share this loan with his loan group, White Rose, which consists of four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy shop inventory, Irish potatoes, cooking oil, and charcoal for cooking chips.

loans.name: Kholbibi

texts.en: Kholbibi is 55 years old, and she lives in Qubadiyon, Tajikistan with her husband, children and grandchildren. She is a very hardworking woman. Kholbibi has been growing vegetables for many years. Currently she does not have enough money to buy seeds, fertilizer, and other necessary supplies for sowing. For this reason she applied for a loan. Kholbibi believes that with the help of Kiva lenders, she will be able to solve her problem.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer, and other necessary supplies for sowing

loans.name: Ry'group

texts.en:
Ry was selected to be the group leader for a loan that the group requested from Maxima. In the group there are two members, and they live in a village in Kandal province.

1 - Ry (pictured here) is 62 years old and lives at Keansvay district, Kandal province, Cambodia. She has been married since 1972 and has four sons and three daughters. Four are married, one is a policeman, one is an electrician, and the last one is attending school.

Ry is a secondary teacher, but now she has been retired for one year in her experience, while her husband has been a policeman for five years. She would like to apply for a loan of $250 to purchase materials for her teaching at home so she can get money to support her family.

2 - Simonn (pictured here) is 29 years old and lives at Keansvay district, Kandal Province, Cambodia. She had been married since 2012 and has one son. Simonn has been a garment worker for three years in her experiences, while her husband has been an air-conditioner electrician for two years. She would like to apply for a loan of $300 to purchase materials to repair her house.

Photo: Ry is on the right, and Simonn is on the left.

loans.use: to purchase a table and a whiteboard for teaching

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to enable him get enough capital to educate his children who are in various schools.

loans.name: Surayo

texts.en:
Surayo is a very responsible and goal-oriented woman. She was born in 1985 in a rural area. She is married and has three children. Her husband supports and helps her to do a business.

She has enough practice from her childhood regarding activities such as keeping livestock and planting potatoes and wheat. She likes her activity.

Every year, her husband leaves for Russia to find a job, but this year, due to currency inflation, her husband decided not to go abroad. Surayo and her husband decided to get a loan to enlarge their business. The conditions where they live are very poor.
She plants agricultural products and will get enough profit to make a payment for the loan from her harvest.

She is asking for a loan to buy ten calves. Surayo hopes to be supported by Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy ten calves.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow in order to increase her milk production and satisfy her customers' demand

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en:
Penina is a 55-year-old lady from Kisumu County. She is a widow who supports four people in her family. She has four children of ages between 27 and 10 years.

She has a food stall where she sells African cuisine, a business she has done for the last four years, earning a monthly income of KES 9,000. 

She is taking her third loan with VisonFund Kenya, which she will use to pay school fees for one of her daughters. 

Penina is hardworking, and hence will use the anticipated profits to reinvest back in her business.

Her dream is to educate her children and increase stock.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her daughter

loans.name: Jinemar

texts.en:
Jinemar is single,very committed and determined man. He dreamed big: to finish his studies and get a stable job for the family. He has taken another loan to pay his tuition fees for the semester.

He strongly believes that "A man without ambition is like a bird flying without direction". For him, to success for there are many good ways to achieve dreams. He thanks GDMPC for the student loan offered and the many lenders who are willing to help anyone who truly wants to succeed.

loans.use: to pay his school tuition fee for the semester.

loans.name: Jeffrey

texts.en:
From Cavite, Philippines, Jeffrey is single but getting married soon. He is employed in a garment factory in Cavite through the auspices of the Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative (CCT). Jeffrey works as a tailor, sewing clothing according to the company or client’s dictates. He uses a sewing machine and other stitching machines and he hand stitches hems and linings as well.

One of the main dilemmas of employees like Jeffrey is meeting family expenses without access to savings or credit. Workers can become heavily indebted to money lenders who take their ATM cards as loan collateral. 

For this reason Jeffrey is asking for your assistance to help him circumvent loan sharks. He has previously accessed loans through CCT and had no problem in repaying them since the loan payments were automatically deducted from his paycheck. He is seeking a 10,000 PHP loan to pay for expenses in his wedding preparations.

Jeffrey wants to have a happy and loving family in the future. He looks forward to your positive response and says any amount will surely be of great help. 

CCT works to provide local communities with a trained labor force equipped with the skills required for employment in construction and site development projects. The cooperative assists its members in acquiring those skills necessary for quality jobs, cultivating savings consciousness and providing decent shelter, food, and education for their families. Its core programs include Professional Staff Services, Workers Guild Development, Enterprise Development and Consultancy Services.

CCT staff and volunteers regularly conduct fellowship meetings for factory workers such as Jeffrey before starting their daily work routine. Bible readings, prayer devotions, spiritual mentoring and discipleship sessions take place during pre- and after-work hours and breaks, powering up the lives of both volunteer leaders and line workers.

loans.use: To pay for his wedding preparation expense.

loans.name: Retchie

texts.en:
From Manila, Retchie has been an active member of CCT for years now, and she was able to acquire several loans to make a good profit from her business. At the age of 33, she is helping her husband to provide for their daily needs. She was inspired to improve their lives because she wants to give her children the best for their future. She works hard each day, and she is pretty sure enough that she is closer to reaching her goals.

Retchie owns a variety store. She believes that business is her steppingstone for making her dreams come to reality. She knows how important it is for her neighbors and daily consumers to have a nearby store where they can buy a sachet of shampoo, a bar of soap, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, an egg, toothpaste, or even ice tube. She gets her products from a wholesaler at a lower price, and then she sells them per piece for a higher price to have a profit.

She desires to manage a bigger store someday, so she is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan, which she will use to buy additional groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She is positive that she will become a successful businesswoman in the future, and she looks forward to seeing her children finish their studies through all her hard work and perseverance.

Retchie meets up every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and to also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries, beverages, and toiletries she needs to keep her profit from her store growing.

loans.name: Juditha

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Juditha works hard to support her family. She has a pig fattening business in the Philippines and earns additional income from farming vegetables. 

Juditha has sustained her business activities through two previous loans from Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She has successfully repaid her loans and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Juditha is borrowing 12,000 Philippine pesos through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Emely

texts.en: Emely is 41 years old and has seven children.  Emely is married and has four children who are in school. She is in the agricultural business farming rice in the Philippines. Emely requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies. Emely has been farming rice for 20 years now, and has borrowed 12 times in the past from NWTF to sustain this. In the future, Emely would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Sammy

texts.en:
Sammy, 49, is a seasoned smallholder farmer from Kibugat Village, found in an area in South Rift known for its high altitude and wet climate. Most of the population in Kibugat Village either practice tea farming or dairy farming or both. Sammy practices dairy farming. His main income source is milk. He has been dairy farming for so long that he sees no other path for himself. He can only dream of growing his dairy farm from where it is today.

Sammy is seeking a loan of KES 40,000 to purchase a cow. The additional cow will bring so much value to Sammy's business. With the new cow, he will utilize excess pasture available, he will have more milk to sell, and soon, he will be having a calf or calves running around his farm. 

Increased income from your loan investment will go towards Sammy's family needs and surplus profit will be rolled back into the business to drive future growth.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a diligent smallholder farmer based in Ndaragwa, Kenya. Samuel has been married to a lovely wife, Mary, for over 15 years. The couple is blessed with two children who are 7 and 12 years old.
 
Seven years ago, Samuel ventured into mixed farming to take better care of his family. Now, he has a two-acre farm that he uses to keep two dairy cows and to grow potatoes. His biggest challenge is the high cost of transporting goods to and from the market. But Samuel has just figured out the perfect solution.
 
Samuel is seeking a loan investment from Kiva lenders to buy a courier motorcycle. With your loan, he will go for a cheap, easy-to-maintain, economical, utility motorcycle made in India. These motorcycles are well-known to local farmers as 'Boda boda'. Boda boda are easy-to-ride, versatile and very affordable to low income earners. With a Boda boda, Samuel will be able to conveniently ferry goods to the market on his own on time. He can also use the multifaceted motorcycle to perform other tasks such as dropping off his wife at work, taking the kids to school and carrying passengers at a small fee during off-peak seasons.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Mwanahamisi

texts.en:
Mwanahamisi is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of creditors staying for long to pay for goods taken on credit. 

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John, 42, is an industrious smallholder farmer from Ndaragwa, Kenya. John is married to a lovely wife, Regina. John and Regina have been married for 17 years. The couple has three children. John practices mixed-farming to provide for his lovely family. 

Twenty years ago, John started farming from scratch. Today, he owns three acres of land which he uses to keep three dairy cows and ten goats. He also has over 100 trees on his property. John is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders to purchase more goats. He finds goat farming to be very enjoyable and lucrative. He has dedicated part of his farm to the growth of fodder for his farm animals. 

Additional income from this investment will be used to raise the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to buy goats

loans.name: Kpangmanga Tampion Group

texts.en:
Samata is a hardworking 40-year-old woman from Tampion in the Northern Region of Ghana. Samata is married and has six children. Samata is the individual pictured with a raised hand among members squatting.

Samata is a member of a shea butter processing group that has been in business for the last 25 years. The name of the group is Kpangmanga Tampion. Samata earns a good profit from the business, as the group has been trained by Grameen Ghana on how to improve their shea butter processing business such that they can always produce premium quality for the local and export markets.

Samata and her group Kpangmanga Tampion have asked for a loan of GHS 8,700. Samata’s share of the loan is GHS 300, which will help her to buy shea nuts for processing. Samata aspires to earn more income to repay this loan, grow her business, and support her children with food and educational materials.

Samata thanks Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To buy shea nuts for processing.

loans.name: Men

texts.en:
Residing in a rural village of the Ou Dong district of Kampong Speu province, Men is a 45-year-old married woman with two children. One of them is in primary school and another one is preparing for university.

Her main source of income is raising pigs for sale. Men has been with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner, for 4 loan cycles. She is requesting a loan in order to send her child to university for electrical engineering. She hopes that her child can have a better job with a higher education. 

Note: This picture is with her husband.

loans.use: to send her child to university for electrical engineering

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Ou Dong District

loans.name: Jesca's Group

texts.en:
Jesca is 61 years old and has seven children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by ten farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. 

Jesca has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2009. This decision was largely a result of her desire to earn enough to feed her family and, although she described her last harvest as good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. 

Jesca also decided to purchase two solar lights as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Jesca's Group will be able to receive a total of 9 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 4.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Makhina

texts.ru: Махина трудолюбивая женщина в возрасте 40 лет. Она замужняя женщина и имеет троих замечательных детей.  Она очень заботливая   мать и жена. По профессии она учительница. Махина работает в школе и имеет пятнадцатилетний опыт работы. Она воспитывает  детей разными методами, и учить их разным языкам.  У нее неплохой заработок, но все же на необходимые условия недостаточны денежных средств,  чтобы осуществить все свои мечты. Её муж в данный момент находится на территории Российской Федерации и каждый месяц по возможности отправляет ей денежные средства. Они недавно купили землю и хотят построит там комфортный дом. Поэтому она обратилась в Арванд для получения кредита  для строительства дома и заранее благодарить Арванду за поддержку!!!
texts.en: Makhina is 40 years old and a hardworking woman.  She is married and the mother of three wonderful children.  She is a caring mother and wife.  She works as a teacher in a school and has 15 years of experience in this field.  She uses various methods to teach her students and teaches them several languages.  She gets a decent salary, however the money is still not enough for all the necessities of life or to enable Makhina to achieve all her dreams.  Her husband is currently in the Russian Federation and he sends as much money as he can every month.  Makhina and her husband recently bought some land and they want to build a comfortable house.  For this reason, Makhina has turned to Arvand to get a loan to build their house.  She thanks Arvand in advance for their support!!!

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Felisters's Group

texts.en:
Felisters is 52 years old and has seven children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by ten farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. 

Felisters has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2008. This decision was largely a result of her desire to earn enough to feed her family and, although she described her last harvest as good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. 

She also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Felisters's Group will be able to receive a total of 8 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 6 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Walma So Zhia - Nagdigu Group

texts.en:
Fulera is a 45-year-old hard working woman from Nagdigu in the northern region of Ghana. She is married and has five children with four of the children attending school. Fulera is the individual pictured raising the right hand among members sitting.

She is a member of a shea butter processing group that has been in business for the last 20 years. The name of the group is Walma So Zhia-Nagdigu. Fulera earns a good profit from the business as the group has been trained by Grameen Ghana on how to improve their shea butter processing business so that they can always produce premium quality for the local and non-local markets.

Fulera and Walma So Zhia-Nagdigu have asked for a loan of GHS 3,900. Fulera’s share of the loan is GHS 300 which would help her to buy shea nuts to process shea butter. She aspires to earn more income as well as to repay this loan and buy her food and clothing.

Fulera thanks Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To buy shea nuts to process shea butter.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a Solar Charging Solution for her clothes business to increase her income

loans.name: Imane

texts.en:
Imane is a 49-year-old, Lebanese married woman, living with her husband and three children. She has been working, doing tailoring at her house to help her family to meet the needs of life. She is a talented tailor, working in this type of business since 2009. She produces different clothing designs and makes repairs as well. She is well known in her region by her good reputation. 

To better develop her work, Imane is requesting a loan from Kiva partner, Vitas s.a.l. She will be using the loan to buy new materials for her business such as textiles, scissors, and many other items, in order to improve her income.

loans.use: to buy new materials for her business such as textiles, scissors, and many other items.

loans.name: Habiba

texts.en:
Habiba is a generous woman. She grew up in a village. She is married. She has one baby. Her husband is working as a carpenter. 

Habiba is a hardworking, gentle and kind person. She had a dream of being a hairdresser. Now she has a place of business where she serves people by making hair styles in the center of village. She has a lot of satisfied and permanent clients and attracts with her qualified work. She is experienced person, and loves her job. She earns enough profit from her activity. 

This type of business is very common in her village that is why she is confident in her duties. She is planning to enlarge her business. She is asking for financial support to buy additional equipment to do hair styles in her wedding salon.

loans.use: to buy additional equipment to do hair styles in her wedding salon

loans.name: Lina

texts.en: Lina is a 37-year-old Lebanese married woman. She lives with her husband and they cooperate together to manage the family’s household expenses. Lina wishes to bring added revenue to her family; that’s why she started her own home business as a private teacher. Her students visit her from all the neighboring villages. She is well known for her high skills. Today, she’s asking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to buy a car for her business. In that way, she will be capable of better developing her work.

loans.use: to buy a car for her business

loans.name: Etibar

texts.en:
Etibar is a 46-year-old gardener. He is married and has a son and a daughter. His wife is a housekeeper. Etibar has been working as a gardener for 26 years and has good experience in this area. He raises apple and pomegranate trees and some green vegetables to sell at the local bazaar. His monthly income is 170 AZN. His son helps him in this work and always supports him.

Etibar started gardening on a very small piece of land. He always dreamed of increasing his small business. From year to year, he saved money from his earnings and has finally bought an additional piece of land for his garden. Now Etibar has applied for a 500 AZN loan to install an irrigation system for his garden. In addition, he hopes to earn more money in future and to buy new garden tools and new fruit trees for his new garden.

loans.use: to install an irrigation system for his garden

loans.name: Nancy Mabel

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Grupo De Crédito La Rosa De Guadalupe. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.
En este lugar vive la señora Nancy, tiene 42 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 22, 21 y 10 años de edad, estudian en universidad  y el menor escuela. Su esposo es chofer.
Doña Nancy es una mujer muy trabajadora que le gusta ir progresando con el paso de los días, ella  tiene un pequeño taller de costura en el cual  confecciona todo tipo de ropa, actualmente esta trabajando en un centro de educación inicial ya que se graduó de párvulo y está ejerciendo su profesión, ella  también junto con su hija mayor tienen un jardín de infantes privado, ya que su hija al igual que ella es profesional en párvulo, su hija es la encargada de brindar el cuidado y educación a los pequeños, ellas también en su casa tiene un centro de eventos que por lo general tienen un compromiso social por semana, de esta forma ella lucha día a día por seguir mejorando su calidad de vida, y esto se facilita gracia a los créditos.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar sillas y mesas tanto para el salón de eventos como para el jardín de infantes y así brindar un mejor servicio. Lleva 5 años  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos. Sus sueños es seguir mejorando sus negocios.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “La Rosa de Guadalupe” (The Rose of Guadalupe) meets every 15 days in the city of Charapoto. This area is known for its cultural tradition and also for being a few minutes away from the best beaches in the province, such as San Jacinto and San Clemente.

Sra. Nancy lives in this place. She is 42 years old, married, and has three children (ages 22, 21, and 10). Two of them are at the university, while the youngest is still in school. Her husband is a chauffeur.

Doña Nancy is a hardworking woman who enjoys making progress as the days go by. She has a small sewing workshop where she produces all types of clothes. Nancy is currently working at a preschool. Having graduated as a child care provider, she now works in this profession. She and her oldest daughter have a private day care center. Her daughter, who is also a professional child care provider, is in charge of looking after the children and teaching them. They also have an events center that they manage out of their home where social gatherings are held throughout the week. Nancy works in this manner each day so that she can continue to improve her quality of life. The loans have helped to facilitate her businesses.

This loan will be used to buy chairs and tables for her events center. This will allow her to prepare for social gatherings, such as children’s parties, so that she can provide better service. Nancy has been with the Communal Bank for five years and enjoys the help that the loans have provided. Her dreams include continuing to improve her businesses.

loans.use: to buy chairs and tables for her social events center.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to enable him to expand his agricultural sector and satisfy his clients in milk supply.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to enable her to get enough income to educate her children and expand her agricultural sector.

loans.name: Esmeralda Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal ESMERALDA, él banco está ubicado en el distrito de Echarate, provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Julia tiene 63 años de edad tiene 5 hijos y es casada, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de agricultura, la socia cultiva lo que son frutas como naranjas entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas y abono.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
 Al momento de tomar la foto una de las socias no salio bien ya que quiso que su hijo tambien saliera en la foto.
texts.en:
Julia belongs to the "ESMERALDA" communal bank which is located in the district of Echarate, La Convención province, Cusco department. Julia is 63 years old, married and has 5 children. She mixes her daily tasks with her agriculture business. She grows fruit like oranges amongst others. She has been in the business for a long time and things are going well for her thanks to the determination she brings to her work each day, this being the way she gets her family ahead.

She is requesting a loan to buy seeds and manure. She is grateful for the loan and promises to comply with the established quotas. At the moment of taking the photo one of the members is hidden from view as she tried to get her child in the photo too.

loans.use: to buy seeds and manure.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 46 years old. She is married with five children. 

She has had a farming business for 20 years. Elizabeth has requested her first loan with VisionFund Kenya of KES 70,000 to purchase farming inputs such as animal feeds, fertilizer, animal licks, pesticides, paracides, and seedlings.

She hopes this will help her to pay her children's school fees and expand her current agricultural practice as well as repay her loan. Her hope and dream for the future is to live a better life with her family.

loans.use: to purchase farming inputs such as animal feeds, fertilizer, animal licks, pesticides, paracides, and seedlings

loans.name: Godelyn

texts.en:
Godelyn, 28, is a resident of Coron, Palawan, Philippines. Has a partner's name is Michael who is a tricycle driver. She works to augment their income to meet their daily personal, household needs.

Godelyn operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a general store is basically a small convenience store which sells fresh, dry, and packaged commodities directly to consumers. Almost all the products are essential household items and food. She earns by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. 

She also makes and sells "halo-halo" which is a traditional Filipino treat consisting of a blend of fruits, sweet preserves, evaporated milk, and shaved ice. It is frequently topped with a scoop of ice cream. The name literally means "Mix-Mix". Her regular customers are her neighbours and the local community. She earns a minimum net income of PHP 700 a day. 

To help her continue operations of her general store business Godelyn is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan to buy grocery items such as sacks of rice, canned goods, soda and other grocery items. Part of the loan will be used to buy the ingredients needed for her "halo-halo" stand. She is positive that it will boost her income as she expands her business. 

She is thanking God and you in advance for a good return on her investment and the financial help that will be given to her, which will surely help fund their daily needs.

Godelyn hopes to maintain and grow her business so that she can save for their planned wedding and lead a happy and victorious life. 

She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, beverages and toiletries to sell.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel, 22, is a smallholder dairy farmer from Cheplanget village based in the Litein region of Kenya. Emmanuel is hardworking and determined to make it in the world of farming. The land he owns is big enough to support more than just dairy animals. He is planning to make use of the available space to start growing food crops. 

Starting a horticultural farm is very costly, especially for smallholder rural farmers. Besides securing land space, a farmer needs to invest in intensive labour, farm tools, and farm inputs. The farmer will also have to construct a store/granary for his/her produce. 

Emmanuel is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders to venture into horticulture. With your loan investment into his business, Emmanuel will be having an alternative source of income besides dairy in the near future. This will not only make his family better off but also open new possibilities for him to diversify further in future.

loans.use: to venture into horticulture farming

loans.name: Ma. Pillar

texts.en:
Ma. Pillar is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Ma. Pillar is 42 years old and has three children who are in school.

Ma. Pillar has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy spare parts and other materials needed for her business.

Ma. Pillar has been in this business for 24 years. In the future, Ma. Pillar would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and other materials needed for her business

loans.name: Raymond

texts.en:
Raymond is a smallholder farmer based in Cheborge village in the South Rift area of Kenya. The 39-year-old farmer mainly practices dairy farming and milk is his main source of income.

In a bid to grow his business, Raymond is seeking a KES 30,000 loan investment from Kiva lenders. He plans to spend this money to buy a dairy cow. The additional dairy cow will not only give him more milk to sell but also expand his asset base once he is done servicing the loan. With that dairy cow, he can secure bigger loans in the future to further grow his business and net worth.

Raymond is not the only one who will benefit from this loan investment. His family, too, will have more income to meet their growing needs.

loans.use: to pay for a dairy cow

loans.name: Ma. Jelyn

texts.en:
Ma. Jelyn is a married woman with three children. Ma. Jelyn is 29 years old and one of her children is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Ma. Jelyn has a fishing business in the Philippines. Ma. Jelyn requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy fish nets and other materials needed.

Ma. Jelyn has been in this business for three years. In the future, Ma. Jelyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other materials needed

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma works hard to support her family. Gemma is married and has a buy-and-sell herbal products business in the Philippines.

Gemma requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of herbal products to sell to her customers.

Gemma has been in this business for 25 years now.

Gemma would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of herbal products to sell to her customers
